directly show commit diffs. The function returns comprehensive information including the
formatted diff, author details, and file changes.

Pull requests and commit hashes related to files can be found via the
'read_file' and 'codebase_search' tools. You should generally use this
tool following a 'codebase_search' toolcall rather than making a new
'codebase_search' or 'read_file' tool call.

pullNumberOrCommitHash.description:
The pull request number (without '#' prefix) or 
commit hash (full or abbreviated). For PR numbers, the function searches 
for commits referencing that PR in their messages.

add_to_memory.name: add_to_memory
add_to_memory.description:
Makes a suggestion to the user to store a piece of learned knowledge

(e.g., about deprecated functions, new patterns, facts about the codebase)
into a persistent knowledge base for future reference by the AI.
User must accept the tool call before the knowledge is stored.
Especially important things to add to the knowledge base are operational
knowledge about the codebase that are not obvious from just the code.
As an example, using 'nvm use' before running terminal commands.
If the user asks to remember something, for something to be saved,
or to create a memory, you MUST use this tool. To update existing knowledge,
provide the existing_knowledge_id parameter.

knowledge_to_store.description:
The specific piece of knowledge or fact to be stored.
It should be no more than a paragraph in length (max 500 characters). 
If the knowledge is an update or contradiction of previous
knowledge, do not mention or refer to the previous
knowledge.

title.description:
The title of the knowledge to be stored. This will be used to look
up and retrieve the knowledge later. This should be a short title
that captures the essence of the knowledge.

existing_knowledge_id.description:
Optional. The ID of existing knowledge
to update instead of creating new
knowledge. If provided, the
knowledge_to_store and title will
replace the existing knowledge entry.

create_diagram.name: create_diagram
create_diagram.description:
Creates a Mermaid diagram that will be rendered in the chat UI. Provide the raw Mermaid DSL string via `content`. Use
for line breaks, always wrap diagram texts/tags in double quotes, do not use custom colors, do not use :::, and do not use beta features. The diagram will be pre-rendered to validate syntax - if there are any Mermaid syntax errors, a MermaidSyntaxError exception will be raised.

content.description: Raw Mermaid diagram definition (e.g., 'graph TD; A-->B;').

fix_lints.name: fix_lints
fix_lints.description:
Attempts to fix linting errors from the last edit by generating and applying new code edits.

This function should be called if a previous edit introduced linting errors.

run.description: A flag to execute the function. Must be True.

fetch_rules.name: fetch_rules
fetch_rules.description:
Fetches rules provided by the user to help with navigating the codebase.

This function fetches rules provided by the user to help with navigating the codebase.
Rules contain information about the codebase that can be used to help with generating code.
If a user's request seems like it would benefit from a rule, this tool is used to fetch the rule.

rule_names.description:
The names of the rules to fetch. Each string in the list
is the name of the rule to fetch.

deep_search.name: deep_search
deep_search.description:
Ask a specialized search model to find relevant files, code blocks, and other context within the codebase.

This tool is expensive since it requires waiting for a sub-agent to do a full search, so you should try to
include all the relevant information in the query and avoid doing multiple searches about the same topic.

query.description:
The search query to ask the search model. The search model will receive NO other context
besides this. It should be a broad query that includes as much information as needed about
the user's high-level goal, so that the search model can provide a comprehensive answer
and you won't need to do additional searching.
Must be between 3 and 1000 characters long and contain at least one alphanumeric character.

get_supplier_contact_by_id.name: get_supplier_contact_by_id
get_supplier_contact_by_id.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier contact by ID.

This function returns full information about a supplier contact, including their
attributes and optionally included related resources such as contact types, phones,
and linked supplier company.

id.description: Required. Unique identifier of the supplier contact.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

update_supplier_contact_by_id.name: update_supplier_contact_by_id
update_supplier_contact_by_id.description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier contact.

This function modifies a supplier contact's attributes and optionally updates related
contact types and phone records. The request body must include the `id` of the contact,
which should match the path parameter.

id.description: Required. Unique identifier of the supplier contact to be updated.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

id.description: Required. Must match the `id` in the URL path.

name.description: Required unless both `first_name` and `last_name` are provided. Full name (≤ 255 chars).

email.description: Required. Email address (≤ 255 chars).

external_id.description: Internal reference ID.

is_suggested.description: If the contact is unapproved or suggested.

body.description: Payload containing the updated supplier contact information.

delete_supplier_contact_by_id.name: delete_supplier_contact_by_id
delete_supplier_contact_by_id.description:
Deletes a supplier contact by its unique identifier.

This function permanently removes the specified supplier contact from the system.

id.description: Required. Unique identifier of the supplier contact to be deleted.

list_spend_categories.name: list_spend_categories
list_spend_categories.description:
Retrieves a list of spend categories.

Allows listing of all available spend categories along with optional usage types. Categories can be used to group procurement, expenses, ad-hoc payments, and supplier invoices.

create_spend_category.name: create_spend_category
create_spend_category.description:
Creates a new spend category with specified attributes.

Spend categories are used to classify spend for procurement, expense, ad-hoc payment, or supplier invoice use cases. Only categories with the "procurement" usage can be used in requisitions.

name.description: Required. Name of the spend category.

external_id.description: External identifier of the category (max 255 characters).

usages.description:
List of applicable usage contexts.
- Allowed values: "procurement", "expense", "ad_hoc_payment", "supplier_invoice"

add_supplier_companies_to_project_by_ext.name: add_supplier_companies_to_project_by_external_id
add_supplier_companies_to_project_by_ext.description: Adds one or more supplier companies to a project using external identifiers.

project_external_id.description: The external identifier of the project.

supplier_external_ids.description: A list of supplier company external IDs to add to the project.

remove_supplier_companies_from_project_b.name: remove_supplier_companies_from_project_by_external_id
remove_supplier_companies_from_project_b.description: Removes one or more supplier companies from a project using external identifiers.

project_external_id.description: The external identifier of the project.

supplier_external_ids.description:
A list of supplier company external IDs to remove from the project.
For optimal performance, it's recommended to remove 10 or fewer
suppliers in a single request.

add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_inte.name: add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_internal_id
add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_inte.description: Adds one or more supplier contacts to a project.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

supplier_contact_ids.description: A list of supplier contact IDs to add to the project.

remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by.name: remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by_internal_id
remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by.description: Removes one or more supplier contacts from a project.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the project.

supplier_contact_ids.description: A list of supplier contact IDs to remove from the project.

get_field_group_by_id.name: get_field_group_by_id
get_field_group_by_id.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific field group by its ID.

This function returns the complete details of a field group identified by its
unique identifier. The function supports both string and integer ID formats.

id.description: The unique identifier of the field group to retrieve.

update_field_group_by_id.name: update_field_group_by_id
update_field_group_by_id.description: Updates the details of an existing field group.

id.description: The unique identifier of the field group to update.

options.description:
A dictionary containing the updated properties for the
field group, including any of the following fields:

id.description: Field group identifier string. Same as the id parameter.

fields.description: List of fields belonging to this group

name.description: Field group name (max 255 characters)

target_object.description:
Field group object type string, one of:
        - "PROJECT"
        - "SUPPLIER_COMPANY"
        - "RFP"

name.description: Field group name (max 255 characters)

delete_field_group_by_id.name: delete_field_group_by_id
delete_field_group_by_id.description: Deletes a specific field group from the system.

id.description: The unique identifier of the field group to delete.

list_custom_fields.name: list_custom_fields
list_custom_fields.description: Returns a list of custom fields for the specified criteria.

filter.description:
A dictionary containing field attributes and their desired values for filtering.
If None, returns all fields. Supported filters:

group_id_equals.description: ID of the group for which fields should be selected

target_object_equals.description: Find custom fields by target class name

create_custom_field.name: create_custom_field
create_custom_field.description:
Create a field with given parameters.

For fields with target_object set to RFP, group relationship should be omitted. It is required to specify the relationship for all other target objects.

new_id.description: The unique identifier for the new field. If not provided, the system will generate a new ID.

options.description: A dictionary containing the field configuration options. Can contain any of the following fields:

name.description: Field name (max 255 characters)
Field name (max 255 characters)

type_description.description:
Internal name and meaning of each field, one of:
        - "Checkbox"
        - "File"
        - "Short Text"
        - "Paragraph"
        - "Date"
        - "Integer"
        - "Currency"
        - "Decimal"
        - "Single Select"
        - "Multiple Select"
        - "URL"
        - "Lookup"
        - "Related"

required.description: Identifies whether the field is required

group.description:
Reference to the field group where the field belongs to
        Note: Must be null for fields with target_object set to RFP, and required for all other fields

list_supplier_company_segmentations.name: list_supplier_company_segmentations
list_supplier_company_segmentations.description:
Returns a list of supplier company segmentations.

This function retrieves all supplier company segmentation definitions,
including label, order, and slug metadata used for categorization or
filtering of supplier companies.

create_supplier_company_segmentation.name: create_supplier_company_segmentation
create_supplier_company_segmentation.description:
Creates a new supplier company segmentation.

This function registers a new segmentation category used to organize supplier
companies within the platform. The segmentation is defined by a label, display order,
and optional slug for programmatic reference.

label.description: Required. Display label for the segmentation (≤ 255 characters).

body.description: Payload defining the segmentation details.

get_supplier_contact_by_external_id.name: get_supplier_contact_by_external_id
get_supplier_contact_by_external_id.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier contact by external ID.

This function returns the full resource representation of a supplier contact
identified by its external ID, with optional inclusion of related entities.

external_id.description:
Required. Unique external identifier of the supplier contact.
Example: "CNT-17"

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

update_supplier_contact_by_external_id.name: update_supplier_contact_by_external_id
update_supplier_contact_by_external_id.description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier contact using the external ID.

The function modifies a supplier contact’s attributes and relationships such as contact types
and phone numbers, identified via the external ID. The request body must include the contact's
internal `id`, which must match the contact's actual identifier in the system.

external_id.description:
Required. Unique external identifier of the supplier contact.
Example: "CNT-17"

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

id.description: Required. Must match the internal ID of the contact being updated.

name.description: Required unless both `first_name` and `last_name` are given. Full name (≤ 255 chars).

email.description: Required. Email address (≤ 255 chars).

notes.description: Optional notes related to the contact.

external_id.description: External ID of the contact.

is_suggested.description: Indicates if the contact was suggested and not yet approved.

body.description: Payload with updated supplier contact details.

delete_supplier_contact_by_external_id.name: delete_supplier_contact_by_external_id
delete_supplier_contact_by_external_id.description:
Deletes a supplier contact using the external identifier.

This function permanently removes the specified supplier contact identified by
its external ID from the system.

external_id.description:
Required. The unique external identifier of the supplier contact.
Example: "CNT-17"

update_contact_type_by_id.name: update_contact_type_by_id
update_contact_type_by_id.description: Updates the details of an existing contact type.

id.description: The unique internal identifier of the contact type to update.

body.description:
A dictionary containing the updated properties for
the contact type. The dictionary must include:

id.description: Contact type identifier

external_id.description: Contact type external identifier (max 255 characters)

name.description: Contact type name (max 255 characters)

delete_contact_type_by_id.name: delete_contact_type_by_id
delete_contact_type_by_id.description: Deletes a contact type from the system.

id.description: The unique internal identifier of the contact type to delete.

list_supplier_companies.name: list_supplier_companies
list_supplier_companies.description:
Retrieves a list of supplier companies matching the specified filters and options.

Supports filtering, pagination, and compound document formatting via the `include` parameter to reduce multiple requests.

filter.description: Filter supplier companies by criteria. One filter per attribute.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include.
- Enum: "attachments", "supplier_category", "supplier_groups", "default_payment_term",
"payment_types", "default_payment_type", "payment_currencies",
"default_payment_currency", "supplier_classification_values"

page.description: Pagination config.

create_supplier_company.name: create_supplier_company
create_supplier_company.description:
Creates a new supplier company with specified attributes, linked resources, and optional custom fields.

Supports internal and external ID references via `external_` prefixes for relationships. Allows compound creation via `include` parameter to return related resources in one request.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
- Enum: "attachments", "supplier_category", "supplier_groups", "default_payment_term",
"payment_types", "default_payment_type", "payment_currencies",
"default_payment_currency", "supplier_classification_values"

attributes.description: It can contain the following keys:

name.description: Required. Supplier company name.

public.description: Optional. Whether the company is public.

external_id.description: Optional. Internal database ID.

name.description: Field name.

value.description: Field value.

relationships.description:
Resource links (optional).
    - supplier_category
    - supplier_groups
    - default_payment_term
    - payment_types
    - default_payment_type
    - payment_currencies
    - default_payment_currency
    - attachments
    - supplier_classification_values

body.description: Supplier company payload.

get_scim_service_provider_config.name: get_scim_service_provider_config
get_scim_service_provider_config.description:
Retrieves the SCIM service provider configuration, describing supported features and capabilities.

This endpoint returns metadata about the SCIM implementation, including patch, filter, bulk, authentication schemes, and more, as specified in Section 5 of RFC 7643.

create_field_options.name: create_field_options
create_field_options.description: Creates a new field option with given parameters..

new_id.description: The field ID to associate the options with. If not provided, the field ID will be generated.

options.description: A list of options to be associated with the field.

list_contract_awards.name: list_contract_awards
list_contract_awards.description:
Retrieves a list of all contract awards in the Workday Strategic Sourcing system.

This function returns all available contract awards, providing comprehensive
information about each award including their associated data and configurations.
The function enables complete visibility into all awards and their current status.

get_contract_award_by_id.name: get_contract_award_by_id
get_contract_award_by_id.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific contract award.

This function returns comprehensive information about a contract award,
including all its associated data and configurations. The function provides
complete visibility into award details and associated metrics.

id.description: The unique internal identifier of the award to retrieve.

list_contract_award_line_items.name: list_contract_award_line_items
list_contract_award_line_items.description:
Retrieves a list of line items associated with a specific contract award.

This function returns all line items that are linked to the specified award ID,
allowing for detailed analysis of award components and their associated data.
The line items provide granular information about the award's components.

award_id.description:
The unique identifier of the award for which to retrieve
line items.

get_contract_award_line_item_by_id.name: get_contract_award_line_item_by_id
get_contract_award_line_item_by_id.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific award line item.

This function returns comprehensive information about a contract award line
item, including all its associated data and configurations. The function
provides complete visibility into line item details and associated metrics.

id.description: The unique identifier of the award line item to retrieve.

get_field_details_by_id.name: get_field_details_by_id
get_field_details_by_id.description: Retrieves the details of an existing field using its internal identifier.

id.description: The internal identifier of the field to retrieve.

update_field_details_by_id.name: update_field_details_by_id
update_field_details_by_id.description:
Updates the details of an existing field using its internal identifier.

Please note, that request body must include an id attribute with the value of your field unique identifier,the same one you passed as argument.

id.description: The internal identifier of the field to update.

options.description:
A dictionary containing the field properties to update.
Must include an 'id' field matching the path parameter.
Contains any of the following fields:

name.description: Field name (max 255 characters)
Field name (max 255 characters)

type_description.description:
Internal name and meaning of each field, one of:
            - "Checkbox"
            - "File"
            - "Short Text"
            - "Paragraph"
            - "Date"
            - "Integer"
            - "Currency"
            - "Decimal"
            - "Single Select"
            - "Multiple Select"
            - "URL"
            - "Lookup"
            - "Related"

required.description: Identifies whether the field is required

group.description:
Reference to the field group where the field belongs to
            Note: Must be null for fields with target_object set to RFP, and required for all other fields

delete_field_by_id.name: delete_field_by_id
delete_field_by_id.description: Deletes a field using its internal identifier.

id.description: The internal identifier of the field to delete.

list_event_templates.name: list_event_templates
list_event_templates.description: Returns a list of all event templates.

get_event_template_by_id.name: get_event_template_by_id
get_event_template_by_id.description: Retrieves the details of an existing event template by its ID.

id.description: The unique internal identifier of the event template to retrieve.

list_field_groups.name: list_field_groups
list_field_groups.description: Returns a list of field groups.

create_field_group.name: create_field_group
create_field_group.description: Creates a new field group with the specified parameters.

name.description: The name of the field group to be created.

description.description:
A detailed description of the field group.
Defaults to an empty string.

data.description: A dictionary containing the field group configuration options. Can contain any of the following fields:

name.description: Field group name (max 255 characters)

fields.description: List of fields belonging to this group

target_object.description:
Field group object type string, one of:
        - "PROJECT"
        - "SUPPLIER_COMPANY"
        - "RFP"

name.description: Field group name (max 255 characters)

get_event_worksheet_by_id.name: get_event_worksheet_by_id
get_event_worksheet_by_id.description: Retrieves the details of an existing worksheet. You need to supply the unique worksheet identifier that was returned upon worksheet creation.

event_id.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the worksheet belongs.

id.description: The unique identifier of the worksheet to retrieve.

update_payment_type_by_external_id.name: update_payment_type_by_external_id
update_payment_type_by_external_id.description: Updates the details of an existing payment type using its external identifier.

external_id.description: The external identifier of the payment type to update.

name.description: The new name for the payment type.

payment_method.description: The new payment method. One of: "Direct Deposit", "Check", "EFT", "Cash", "Credit Card", "Wire", "Manual", "Direct Debit", "PayPal", "EFT with Reference"

delete_payment_type_by_external_id.name: delete_payment_type_by_external_id
delete_payment_type_by_external_id.description: Deletes a payment type using its external identifier.

external_id.description: The external identifier of the payment type to delete.

get_supplier_company_contact_by_id.name: get_supplier_company_contact_by_id
get_supplier_company_contact_by_id.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing supplier company contact.

This function locates a specific contact using both the company ID and contact ID,
then returns the complete contact details with optional related resource inclusion.

company_id.description:
The unique identifier of the supplier company.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the company.

contact_id.description:
The unique identifier of the contact.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the contact.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include
in the response. Not fully implemented in simulation.

update_supplier_company_contact_by_id.name: update_supplier_company_contact_by_id
update_supplier_company_contact_by_id.description:
Updates the details of an existing supplier company contact.

This function allows modification of contact information by providing updated
values for specific fields. The contact is identified by both company ID and
contact ID.

company_id.description:
The unique identifier of the supplier company.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the company.

contact_id.description:
The unique identifier of the contact.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the contact.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include
in the response. Not fully implemented in simulation.

name.description: The contact's full name

email.description: The contact's email address

role.description: The contact's role in the company

status.description: The contact's status

body.description:
Dictionary containing the fields to update.
Required fields:
- At least one field to update
Optional fields:

delete_supplier_company_contact_by_id.name: delete_supplier_company_contact_by_id
delete_supplier_company_contact_by_id.description:
Deletes a supplier company contact.

This function removes a specific contact from the system using both the company ID
and contact ID for identification.

company_id.description:
The unique identifier of the supplier company.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the company.

contact_id.description:
The unique identifier of the contact.
This is the internal ID used by the system to reference the contact.

add_supplier_companies_to_event_by_inter.name: add_supplier_companies_to_event_by_internal_id
add_supplier_companies_to_event_by_inter.description: Add suppliers to an event. Only events of type RFP are supported.

event_id.description:
The unique identifier of the event to which suppliers
will be added.

data.description: A dictionary containing the supplier information, including:

supplier_ids.description: A list of supplier IDs to be added to the event

remove_supplier_companies_from_event_by_.name: remove_supplier_companies_from_event_by_internal_id
remove_supplier_companies_from_event_by_.description: Remove suppliers from an event. Only events of type RFP are supported.

event_id.description:
The unique identifier of the event from which suppliers
will be removed.

data.description: A dictionary containing the supplier information, including:

supplier_ids.description: A list of supplier IDs to be removed from the event

list_bid_line_items_for_bid.name: list_bid_line_items_for_bid
list_bid_line_items_for_bid.description:
Returns a list of line items associated with a specific bid.

This function returns all line items that are linked to the specified bid ID,
allowing for detailed analysis of bid components and their associated data.

bid_id.description: The unique identifier of the bid for which to retrieve line items.

list_performance_review_report_entries.name: list_performance_review_report_entries
list_performance_review_report_entries.description:
Retrieves a list of performance review report entries.

Returns detailed performance review report data in a paginated format. Each entry contains attributes related to a performance review. Use pagination links to iterate through results.

get_performance_review_report_schema.name: get_performance_review_report_schema
get_performance_review_report_schema.description:
Retrieves the schema for the performance review report.

The schema defines the structure of performance review report entries, including field types and names. This is useful for dynamically building forms, validating input, or rendering reports.

get_project_type_by_id.name: get_project_type_by_id
get_project_type_by_id.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific project type using its unique identifier.

id.description: Unique identifier of the project type.

list_supplier_company_contacts_by_compan.name: list_supplier_company_contacts_by_company_external_id
list_supplier_company_contacts_by_compan.description:
Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific supplier company.

This function returns supplier contacts associated with a given supplier company ID.
Supports detailed filtering, relationship includes, and pagination options.

company_id.description:
Required. Unique identifier of the supplier company.
Example: 1

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Allowed values:
- "supplier_company"
- "contact_types"
- "phones"

updated_at_from.description: Return contacts updated on or after this timestamp.

updated_at_to.description: Return contacts updated on or before this timestamp.

filter.description:
Dictionary of filter parameters to narrow down contact results.
Supported filters include:

list_scim_schemas.name: list_scim_schemas
list_scim_schemas.description:
Retrieves the list of supported SCIM schemas and their attribute definitions.

This endpoint provides metadata about each schema in use, including its attributes and constraints. Refer to Section 3.4 of RFC 7644 for schema discovery guidance.

get_scim_user_by_id.name: get_scim_user_by_id
get_scim_user_by_id.description:
Retrieves the details of a single user by SCIM resource ID.

This endpoint conforms to SCIM 2.0 RFC 7644 Section 3.4.1, returning user metadata,
core attributes, and optional related roles or identifiers.

id.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to retrieve.

attributes.description:
Optional comma-separated list of attributes to return in the response.
Allowed:
- "userName"
- "name.familyName"
- "name.givenName"
- "roles"
- "roles.value"
- "externalId"
- "active"
- "meta.lastModified"
- "meta.created"

filter.description:
Optional filter to apply to the user search.
Currently not implemented.

partially_update_scim_user_by_id.name: partially_update_scim_user_by_id
partially_update_scim_user_by_id.description:
Applies partial updates to a User resource using a sequence of SCIM-compliant patch operations.

This endpoint supports `add`, `remove`, and `replace` operations as described in RFC 7644 Section 3.5.2.
Common use cases include changing the user's name, deactivating accounts, or updating metadata.

Note:
    - Users cannot deactivate their own account (403).
    - Changes to `userName` require both the original and target domains to match those configured in the company SSO setup.
    - All PATCH operations must conform to SCIM and system-specific constraints.

id.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to patch.

schemas.description: SCIM schema identifiers. Must include SCIM PATCH schema URI.

path.description: SCIM path to the attribute being modified. Required for "remove".

value.description: Value to assign or append. Can be a primitive or nested structure.

Operations.description: A list of operations to apply.

body.description:
A dictionary containing the patch operations, conforming to SCIM schema.
It must contain the following keys:

replace_scim_user_by_id.name: replace_scim_user_by_id
replace_scim_user_by_id.description:
Replaces all updatable attributes of a User resource as per RFC 7644 Section 3.5.1.

This operation replaces only the attributes provided in the request payload, leaving any others intact.
Users cannot deactivate themselves or modify their email domain unless it's compliant with configured SSO rules.

id.description: Unique SCIM identifier of the user to update.

userName.description: Required. User's email address. Must match configured SSO domain for updates.

active.description: Optional. Whether the user account is active.

body.description: A dictionary containing the user attributes to update.

deactivate_scim_user_by_id.name: deactivate_scim_user_by_id
deactivate_scim_user_by_id.description:
Deactivates a user by their unique identifier.

This operation marks the user as inactive. The core logic to prevent self-deactivation
(which would result in a 403 error) or to handle a non-existent user (404 error)
is assumed to be part of the broader system or interactions with the 'db' object.

id.description: Unique SCIM user identifier of the user to deactivate.

list_project_milestone_report_entries.name: list_project_milestone_report_entries
list_project_milestone_report_entries.description:
Retrieves a list of project milestone report entries.

Each milestone entry provides details related to project milestones.

get_project_milestone_report_schema.name: get_project_milestone_report_schema
get_project_milestone_report_schema.description:
Retrieves the schema definition for project milestone reports.

This endpoint provides metadata describing the fields available in project milestone reporting. Useful for dynamically rendering forms or parsing report data.

update_payment_currency_by_external_id.name: update_payment_currency_by_external_id
update_payment_currency_by_external_id.description: Updates the details of an existing payment currency using its external identifier.

external_id.description: The external identifier of the currency to update.

alpha.description: The new three-letter currency code (e.g., USD, EUR).

delete_payment_currency_by_external_id.name: delete_payment_currency_by_external_id
delete_payment_currency_by_external_id.description: Deletes a payment currency using its external identifier.

external_id.description: The external identifier of the currency to delete.

list_contact_types.name: list_contact_types
list_contact_types.description: Retrieves a list of all contact types in the system.

create_contact_type.name: create_contact_type
create_contact_type.description:
Creates a new contact type with the specified parameters.

This function allows for the creation of a new contact type in the system
with the provided configuration and properties. The function validates the
input and ensures all required fields are present.

body.description:
A dictionary containing the properties and
configuration for the new contact type. The dictionary should
include:

external_id.description: Contact type external identifier (max 255 characters)

name.description: Contact type name (max 255 characters)

update_field_options_by_id.name: update_field_options_by_id
update_field_options_by_id.description: Update a field options with given parameters.

id.description: The unique identifier of the field option to update.

new_options.description: A list of new options to set for the field option.

delete_field_options_by_id.name: delete_field_options_by_id
delete_field_options_by_id.description: Deletes a field option from the system.

id.description: The unique identifier of the field option to delete.

list_savings_report_entries.name: list_savings_report_entries
list_savings_report_entries.description:
Retrieves a list of savings report entries.

Returns all savings-related entries available to the authenticated user.

get_savings_report_schema.name: get_savings_report_schema
get_savings_report_schema.description:
Retrieves the schema definition for the savings report.

The schema provides a list of fields and their types used in the savings report entries. This is useful for understanding the expected structure and available data fields when creating or interpreting report entries.

list_event_report_entries.name: list_event_report_entries
list_event_report_entries.description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries.

Event report entries contain detailed records of events captured within the system. These can include audit events, workflow triggers, system updates, etc. The response is paginated and supports traversal through `next` and `prev` links.

get_event_report_entries_by_report_id.name: get_event_report_entries_by_report_id
get_event_report_entries_by_report_id.description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries for a specific event report.

This endpoint provides detailed entries linked to a single event report, identified by `event_report_id`. It is useful for retrieving scoped data related to a specific event. The response is paginated.

event_report_id.description: Unique identifier for the event report to retrieve entries from.

list_user_owned_event_report_entries.name: list_user_owned_event_report_entries
list_user_owned_event_report_entries.description:
Retrieves a list of event report entries owned by the user.

**Deprecated**: This endpoint is only supported in API version 2018-04-01 and has been deprecated as of 2019-01-01. It returns report entries specific to the authenticated user.

get_event_report_schema.name: get_event_report_schema
get_event_report_schema.description:
Retrieves the schema definition for event report entries.

This schema provides metadata about the fields available in event report entries, including their names and data types. It can be used to dynamically interpret and render event report data.

get_scim_schema_by_uri.name: get_scim_schema_by_uri
get_scim_schema_by_uri.description:
Retrieves a specific SCIM schema by its URI.

This endpoint provides the structure and metadata for a SCIM resource type, including all attributes and constraints, as defined by the schema URI (e.g., User, Group).

uri.description:
Schema URI identifying the SCIM resource type.
- Example: "urn:ietf:params:scim:schemas:core:2.0:User"

list_event_worksheets.name: list_event_worksheets
list_event_worksheets.description: Returns a list of all worksheets.

event_id.description: The unique identifier of the event to which the worksheets belong.

add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_intern.name: add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_internal_id
add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_intern.description: Adds supplier contacts to a specific event. Only events of type RFP are supported.

event_id.description:
The unique identifier of the event to which supplier
contacts will be added.

data.description:
A dictionary containing the supplier contact information,
including:

supplier_contact_ids.description:
A list of supplier contact IDs to be
    added to the event

remove_supplier_contacts_from_event_by_i.name: remove_supplier_contacts_from_event_by_internal_id
remove_supplier_contacts_from_event_by_i.description: Remove suppliers from an event using supplier contacts. Only events of type RFP are supported.

event_id.description:
The unique identifier of the event from which supplier
contacts will be removed.

data.description:
A dictionary containing the supplier contact information,
including:

supplier_contact_ids.description:
A list of supplier contact IDs to be
    removed from the event

list_contracts.name: list_contracts
list_contracts.description:
Retrieve a list of contracts based on specified criteria.

This function supports filtering, relationship inclusion, and pagination of contracts.
Contracts can be filtered based on any attribute present in the contract object.

filter.description: Dictionary containing filter criteria for contracts. Supported filters:

updated_at_from.description: Return contracts updated on or after timestamp

updated_at_to.description: Return contracts updated on or before timestamp

title_contains.description: Return contracts with title containing string

title_not_contains.description: Return contracts with title not containing string

description_contains.description: Return contracts with description containing string

description_not_contains.description: Return contracts with description not containing string

external_id_equals.description: Find contracts by specific external ID

external_id_not_equals.description: Find contracts excluding specified external ID

actual_start_date_from.description: Return contracts started on or after date

actual_start_date_to.description: Return contracts started on or before date

actual_end_date_from.description: Return contracts ended on or after date

actual_end_date_to.description: Return contracts ended on or before date

needs_attention_equals.description: Return contracts with specified needs attention status

needs_attention_not_equals.description: Return contracts with needs attention status not equal

terminated_note_contains.description: Return contracts with termination note containing string

terminated_note_not_contains.description: Return contracts with termination note not containing string

terminated_note_empty.description: Return contracts with empty termination note

terminated_note_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty termination note

terminated_reason_contains.description: Return contracts with termination reason containing string

terminated_reason_not_contains.description: Return contracts with termination reason not containing string

terminated_reason_empty.description: Return contracts with empty termination reason

terminated_reason_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty termination reason

contract_type_id_equals.description: Find contracts with specified contract type

contract_type_id_not_equals.description: Find contracts with different contract type

marked_as_needs_attention_at_from.description: Find contracts marked needs attention after date

marked_as_needs_attention_at_to.description: Find contracts marked needs attention before date

needs_attention_note_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention note containing string

needs_attention_note_not_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention note not containing string

needs_attention_note_empty.description: Return contracts with empty needs attention note

needs_attention_note_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty needs attention note

needs_attention_reason_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention reason containing string

needs_attention_reason_not_contains.description: Return contracts with needs attention reason not containing string

needs_attention_reason_empty.description: Return contracts with empty needs attention reason

needs_attention_reason_not_empty.description: Return contracts with non-empty needs attention reason

renewal_termination_notice_date_from.description: Find contracts with termination notice date >= specified

renewal_termination_notice_date_to.description: Find contracts with termination notice date <= specified

renewal_termination_reminder_date_from.description: Find contracts with termination reminder date >= specified

renewal_termination_reminder_date_to.description: Find contracts with termination reminder date <= specified

spend_category_id_equals.description: Find contracts using specified Spend Category IDs

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include in response.
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", 
"docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

page.description: Dictionary containing pagination parameters:

size.description: Number of results per page (default: 10, max: 100)

create_contract.name: create_contract
create_contract.description: Create a new contract with the specified attributes.

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of relationships to include
in the response. 
Supported values: "contract_type", "spend_category", "supplier_company", "docusign_envelopes", "adobe_sign_agreements"

body.description: Dictionary containing contract creation data. Contains any of the following keys:

external_id.description: External contract identifier

title.description: Required. Contract title (max 255 characters)

state.description:
Required. Current contract state, one of:
        - "draft"
        - "requested"
        - "in_progress"
        - "out_for_approval"
        - "approved"
        - "active"
        - "expired"
        - "terminated"

external_id.description: Optional. Customer provided unique contract identifier

marked_as_needs_attention_at.description: Optional. Date when contract was flagged as needs attention

needs_attention_note.description: Optional. Notes on why contract needs attention

needs_attention_reason.description: Optional. Reason why contract needs attention

renew_number_of_times.description: Optional. Number of times contract should be renewed

renewal_term_unit.description:
Optional. Term unit for renewals, one of:
        - "days"
        - "weeks"
        - "months"
        - "years"

renewal_term_value.description: Optional. Number of term units between renewals

renewal_termination_notice_unit.description: Optional. Term unit for termination notice

renewal_termination_notice_value.description: Optional. Term units before end date for notice

renewal_termination_reminder_unit.description: Optional. Term unit for termination reminder

renewal_termination_reminder_value.description: Optional. Term units before notice for reminder

approval_rounds.description: Optional. Times contract has been sent for approval

owner.description: Required. Contract owner with:

id.description: Required. Owner identifier
Required. Supplier company identifier
Required. Contract type identifier
Required. Spend category identifier
Required. Payment currency identifier

add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_extern.name: add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_external_ids
add_supplier_contacts_to_event_by_extern.description: Add suppliers to an event using supplier contacts. Only events of type RFP are supported. You must supply the unique event external identifier (the one you used when created the event). You must supply the external identifiers of the supplier contacts too. The operation will be rolled back upon any failure, and invitations won't be sent. For best performance, we recommend inviting 10 or less supplier contacts in a single request.

event_external_id.description: The unique external identifier of the event to which suppliers will be added.

data.description: A dictionary containing the supplier contact information, including:

supplier_contact_external_ids.description: A list of supplier contact external IDs to be added to the event

remove_supplier_contacts_from_event_by_e.description: Remove suppliers from an event using supplier contacts. Only events of type RFP are supported. You must supply the unique event external identifier (the one you used when created the event). You must supply the external identifiers of the supplier contacts too. The operation will be rolled back upon any failure, and invitations won't be removed. For best performance, we recommend removing 10 or less supplier contacts in a single request.

event_external_id.description: The unique external identifier of the event from which supplier contacts will be removed.

data.description: A dictionary containing the supplier contact information, including:

supplier_contact_external_ids.description: A list of supplier contact external IDs to be removed from the event

Comma-separated list of related resources to include.
Currently not fully implemented.

filter.description:
Optional filter criteria to apply to contacts.
Each key-value pair in the dictionary will be used to filter contacts.

updated_at_from.description: Return events updated on or after timestamp

updated_at_to.description: Return events updated on or before timestamp

title_not_contains.description: Return events with title not containing string

supplier_rsvp_deadline_not_empty.description: Return events with RSVP deadline set

created_at_from.description: Return events created on or after timestamp

created_at_to.description: Return events created on or before timestamp

published_at_from.description: Return events published on or after timestamp

published_at_to.description: Return events published on or before timestamp

closed_at_from.description: Return events closed on or after timestamp

closed_at_to.description: Return events closed on or before timestamp

spend_amount_from.description: Return events with spend amount >= amount

spend_amount_to.description: Return events with spend amount <= amount

spend_amount_empty.description: Return events with spend amount not set

spend_amount_not_empty.description: Return events with spend amount set

external_id_equals.description: Find events by specific external ID

external_id_not_equals.description: Find events excluding specified external ID

get_supplier_company_by_external_id.name: get_supplier_company_by_external_id

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response. 
Enum values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

update_supplier_company_by_external_id.name: update_supplier_company_by_external_id
update_supplier_company_by_external_id.description:
Updates an existing supplier company using its external identifier.

This endpoint allows updating a supplier company's attributes and relationships using its external ID. The request body must include an `id` that matches the identifier in the path.

external_id.description: Required. External identifier of the supplier company (e.g., "1234-5678-abcd-efgh").

_include.description:
Comma-separated list of related resources to include in the response.
Enum values:
- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"
- "default_payment_type"
- "payment_currencies"
- "default_payment_currency"
- "supplier_classification_values"

id.description: Supplier company ID.

name.description: Required. Company name (max 255 characters).

external_id.description: Custom external ID.

name.description: Name of the custom field.

value.description: Value, based on field type.

relationships.description:
Updated linked resources.
    - supplier_category, external_supplier_category (dict): Supplier category by ID or external ID.
    - supplier_groups, external_supplier_groups (List[dict]): Group associations by ID or external ID.
    - default_payment_term, external_default_payment_term (dict): Default payment term by ID or external ID.
    - payment_types, external_payment_types (List[dict]): Accepted payment types.
    - default_payment_type, external_default_payment_type (dict): Default payment method.
    - payment_currencies, external_payment_currencies (List[dict]): Accepted currencies.
    - default_payment_currency, external_default_payment_currency (dict): Default currency.

body.description: The payload used to update the supplier company.

filter the results based on specific criteria.

A dictionary containing field-value pairs to filter
the bid line items. Each key in the dictionary represents a field name,
and its corresponding value is the exact value to match.
Example: {"bid_id": 123, "status": "active"}
Defaults to None, which returns all bid line items.

- "attachments"
- "supplier_category"
- "supplier_groups"
- "default_payment_term"
- "payment_types"

list_scim_users.name: list_scim_users
list_scim_users.description:
Retrieves a list of users based on specified filtering, sorting, and pagination criteria.

This endpoint adheres to SCIM (System for Cross-domain Identity Management) standards.
Supports complex filtering via SCIM filter syntax and offers a 100-item default page size.

attributes.description:
Comma-separated list of specific attributes to return.
- Enum: "userName", "name.familyName", "name.givenName", "roles", "roles.value",
"externalId", "active", "meta.lastModified", "meta.created", "id"

filter.description:
SCIM-compliant filter expression to search for users.
Example:
    'userName eq "jhon.doe@example.com" and meta.lastModified gt "2011-05-13T04:42:34Z"'
Supported attributes:
    - "userName"
    - "name.familyName"
    - "name.givenName"
    - "roles"
    - "roles.value"
    - "externalId"
    - "active"
    - "meta.lastModified"
    - "meta.created"
Supported operators:
    - eq: Equal to
    - ne: Not equal to
    - lt: Less than
    - le: Less than or equal to
    - gt: Greater than
    - ge: Greater than or equal to
    - pr: Present
    - co: Contains
    - and: Logical "and"
    - or: Logical "or"
    - not: Logical "not"

startIndex.description: 1-based index of the first query result. Must be >= 1.

count.description: Number of results to return per page. Must be >= 0.

sortBy.description:
Attribute used to order results.
- Allowed values: "id", "externalId"

create_scim_user.name: create_scim_user
create_scim_user.description:
Creates a new user with the specified attributes.

This operation is SCIM-compliant and requires a payload defining the user details.
Supports external identifiers for integration with client systems.

userName.description: Required. Email address of the user.

name.description: Required. Name object with:

active.description: Optional. Whether the user account is active.

roles.description: Optional. Roles assigned to the user.

body.description: The user resource to create. The structure is defined by the SCIM User schema.

list_scim_resource_types.description:
Lists SCIM resource types available on the service provider.

This endpoint allows clients to discover all supported SCIM resource types and their associated metadata, including endpoint paths and schemas. This is based on Section 4 of RFC 7644.

This endpoint provides the schema, endpoint path, and any extensions supported for a given SCIM resource (e.g., "User"). It returns a subset of the information available from the general `/ResourceTypes` endpoint, focusing on a single resource type.

resource.description:
Name of the SCIM resource type.
- Example: "User"

delete_spend_category_by_id.description:

The identifier must match the one returned during spend category creation. This operation is irreversible and will permanently remove the category.

add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_exte.name: add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_external_ids
add_supplier_contacts_to_project_by_exte.description:
Adds suppliers to a project using supplier contact external identifiers.

This endpoint links supplier contacts to an existing project by referencing their external identifiers. This is particularly useful for bulk-inviting suppliers already registered in the system.

project_external_id.description: External ID of the project to which suppliers should be added.

supplier_contact_external_ids.description: External IDs of the supplier contacts to add to the project.

remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by.name: remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by_external_ids
remove_supplier_contacts_from_project_by.description:
Removes suppliers from a project using supplier contact external identifiers.

This endpoint disassociates supplier contacts from a specific project using their external IDs. This is commonly used to manage supplier participation in projects dynamically.

project_external_id.description: External ID of the project from which suppliers are to be removed.

supplier_contact_external_ids.description: External IDs of the supplier contacts to remove from the project.

azmcp_appconfig_account_list.name: azmcp_appconfig_account_list
azmcp_appconfig_account_list.description:
List all App Configuration stores in a subscription.

This function retrieves and displays all App Configuration stores available in the
specified subscription. The results are returned as a list of dictionaries,
where each dictionary contains details of an App Configuration store,
including its name, ID, and location.

subscription.description:
The Azure subscription ID or name. This can be either
the GUID identifier or the display name of the Azure subscription to use.

auth_method.description:
Authentication method to use. Options:
'credential' (Azure CLI/managed identity), 'key' (access key),
or 'connectionString'. Defaults to None.

tenant.description:
The Azure Active Directory tenant ID or name.
This can be either the GUID identifier or the display name of your
Azure AD tenant. Defaults to None.

retry_max_retries.description:
Maximum number of retry attempts for
failed operations before giving up. Defaults to None.

retry_delay.description:
Initial delay in seconds between retry
attempts. For exponential backoff, this value is used as the base.
Defaults to None.

retry_max_delay.description:
Maximum delay in seconds between retries,
regardless of the retry strategy. Defaults to None.

retry_mode.description:
Retry strategy to use. 'fixed' uses
consistent delays, 'exponential' increases delay between attempts.
Defaults to None.

retry_network_timeout.description:
Network operation timeout in
seconds. Operations taking longer than this will be cancelled.
Defaults to None.

azmcp_appconfig_kv_delete.name: azmcp_appconfig_kv_delete
azmcp_appconfig_kv_delete.description:
Delete a key-value pair from an App Configuration store.

This command removes the specified key-value pair from the store.
If a label is specified, only the labeled version is deleted. If no label is specified, the key-value with the matching
key and the default label will be deleted.

subscription.description: The Azure subscription ID or name. This can be either the GUID identifier or the display name of the Azure subscription to use.

account_name.description: The name of the App Configuration store (e.g., my-appconfig).

key.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

auth_method.description: Authentication method to use. Options: 'credential' (Azure CLI/managed identity), 'key' (access key), or 'connectionString'.

label.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

retry_delay.description: Initial delay in seconds between retry attempts. For exponential backoff, this value is used as the base.

retry_max_delay.description: Maximum delay in seconds between retries, regardless of the retry strategy.

retry_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts for failed operations before giving up.

retry_mode.description: Retry strategy to use. 'fixed' uses consistent delays, 'exponential' increases delay between attempts.

retry_network_timeout.description: Network operation timeout in seconds. Operations taking longer than this will be cancelled.

tenant.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant ID or name. This can be either the GUID identifier or the display name of your Azure AD tenant.

azmcp_appconfig_kv_list.name: azmcp_appconfig_kv_list
azmcp_appconfig_kv_list.description:
List all key-values in an App Configuration store.

This command retrieves and displays all key-value pairs
from the specified store. Each key-value includes its key, value, label, content type, ETag, last modified
time, and lock status.

subscription.description:
The Azure subscription ID or name. This can be either the GUID
identifier or the display name of the Azure subscription to use.

account_name.description: The name of the App Configuration store (e.g., my-appconfig).

auth_method.description:
Authentication method to use. Options: 'credential'
(Azure CLI/managed identity), 'key' (access key), or 'connectionString'.

key.description:
Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving
key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of "foo"
would get all key-values with a key of "foo", or the filter can include a '*'
character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (e.g., 'App*').
If omitted all keys will be retrieved.

label.description:
Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving
key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of "foo"
would get all key-values with a label of "foo", or the filter can include a '*'
character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (e.g., 'Prod*').
This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels will be retrieved.

retry_delay.description:
Initial delay in seconds between retry attempts. For
exponential backoff, this value is used as the base.

retry_max_delay.description:
Maximum delay in seconds between retries, regardless
of the retry strategy.

retry_max_retries.description:
Maximum number of retry attempts for failed
operations before giving up.

retry_mode.description:
Retry strategy to use. 'fixed' uses consistent delays,
'exponential' increases delay between attempts.

retry_network_timeout.description:
Network operation timeout in seconds. Operations
taking longer than this will be cancelled.

tenant.description:
The Azure Active Directory tenant ID or name. This can be
either the GUID identifier or the display name of your Azure AD tenant.

azmcp_appconfig_kv_lock.description:
Lock a key-value in an App Configuration store.

This function sets a key-value in an App Configuration store to read-only mode,

labeled version of the key-value.

retry_network_timeout.description: Network operation timeout in seconds. Operations taking longer than this will be cancelled. Defaults to None.

This function sets a key-value setting in an App Configuration store. It creates or

value must be specified. Optionally, a label can be specified; otherwise, the
default label is used.

tenant.description:

This function retrieves and displays the value, label, content type, ETag,

update_meeting_space.name: update_meeting_space
update_meeting_space.description:
Updates details about a meeting space.

This function modifies the specified fields of an existing meeting space. Only fields
that are included in the update_mask will be changed.

name.description: The name of the space to update.

update_mask.description:
A dictionary containing the fields to update
and their new values. If provided, known fields like 'id', 'meetingCode',
'meetingUri', 'accessType', 'entryPointAccess' must adhere to their
expected types (typically string). Additional arbitrary fields and their
values are also permitted, aligning with the Pydantic model SpaceUpdateMaskModel.

get_customer_by_id.name: get_customer_by_id
get_customer_by_id.description:
Retrieves a single customer by their unique identifier with optional field selection.

This endpoint fetches complete customer information for a specific customer ID. You can optimize the response by requesting only specific fields, which is useful for reducing payload size when you only need certain customer attributes. The function returns comprehensive customer data including personal information, order statistics, addresses, and account metadata.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier for the customer. Must be a non-empty string representing the customer's ID in the system.
Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123', '1073339462'.

fields.description:
Specific customer fields to include in the response. Each field name must be a valid customer attribute. Supports nested field access for addresses.
Examples: ['id', 'email', 'first_name'] (basic info), ['id', 'orders_count', 'total_spent'] (order data), ['default_address', 'addresses'] (address info).
Default is None (all available fields).

search_customers.name: search_customers
search_customers.description:
Searches for customers using flexible query syntax with support for filtering, pagination, and field selection.

This endpoint enables powerful customer search capabilities using Shopify's query language syntax. You can search by customer attributes like email, name, phone, tags, order count, and dates. The function supports cursor-based pagination for handling large result sets and allows selective field retrieval to optimize response size. Results can be sorted by various customer fields in ascending or descending order.

query.description:
The search query string using Shopify query syntax. Supports field-specific searches, comparison operators, and logical combinations.
Examples: 'Bob Norman' (name search), 'email:bob.norman@mail.example.com' (exact email), 'orders_count:>5' (customers with more than 5 orders), 'tag:VIP AND created_at:>2023-01-01' (VIP customers created after date), 'phone:+1*' (phone numbers starting with +1).

limit.description:
Maximum number of customer results to retrieve. Must be between 1 and 250.
Default is 50.

page_info.description:
Pagination token for cursor-based navigation. Use the next_page_token from a previous response to get the next page of results.
Default is None (first page).

fields.description:
Specific customer fields to include in the response. Supports nested field access using dot notation.
Examples: ['id', 'email', 'first_name'] (basic fields), ['id', 'default_address.city', 'addresses.country'] (nested fields).
Default is None (all available fields).

order.description:
Sort order specification in format 'field_name DIRECTION'. Field must be a valid sortable customer field, direction must be 'ASC' or 'DESC'.
Examples: 'updated_at DESC', 'orders_count ASC', 'last_name ASC'.
Default is None (sorted by customer ID ascending).

list_customers.name: list_customers
list_customers.description:
Retrieves a filtered list of customers with support for date ranges, field selection, and pagination.

This endpoint provides comprehensive customer listing capabilities with multiple filtering options including creation and update date ranges, specific customer ID selection, and field-level response customization. The function supports both offset-based pagination via since_id and result limiting for efficient data retrieval. You can optimize response payload by requesting only specific customer fields, making it ideal for bulk customer operations and data synchronization tasks.

created_at_max.description:
Filter customers created before this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone.
Examples: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00', '2023-12-31T23:59:59Z', '2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'.
Default is None (no upper date limit).

created_at_min.description:
Filter customers created after this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone.
Examples: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00', '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z', '2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00'.
Default is None (no lower date limit).

fields.description:
Specific customer fields to include in each response object. Reduces payload size when only certain data is needed.
Examples: ['id', 'email', 'first_name'] (basic info), ['id', 'orders_count', 'total_spent'] (order metrics), ['email', 'tags', 'state'] (marketing data).
Default is None (all available fields).

ids.description:
Specific customer IDs to retrieve. When provided, only customers with these IDs are returned.
Examples: ['207119551', '1073339462'], ['cust_abc123', 'cust_def456'].
Default is None (no ID filtering).

limit.description:
Maximum number of customers to return in a single response. Must be between 1 and 250.
Examples: 10 (small batch), 50 (default), 250 (maximum).
Default is 50.

since_id.description:
Return customers with IDs greater than this value for pagination. Used for offset-based pagination.
Examples: 207119551, 1073339462.
Default is None (start from beginning).

updated_at_max.description:
Filter customers last updated before this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone.
Examples: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00', '2023-12-31T23:59:59Z'.
Default is None (no upper update date limit).

updated_at_min.description:
Filter customers last updated after this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone.
Examples: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00', '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z'.
Default is None (no lower update date limit).

get_customer_orders.name: get_customer_orders
get_customer_orders.description:
Retrieves all orders belonging to a specific customer with comprehensive filtering and field selection capabilities.

This endpoint provides access to a customer's complete order history with flexible filtering options including order status, creation date ranges, and financial status. By default, only open orders are returned to focus on active business. The function supports field-level response customization to optimize payload size and includes comprehensive order details including line items, pricing, and customer information for each returned order.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the customer whose orders should be retrieved. Must be a non-empty string representing a valid customer ID in the system.
Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123', '1073339462'.

status.description:
Filter orders by their current status. Controls which orders are included based on their lifecycle state.
Valid values: 'open' (active orders), 'closed' (completed orders), 'cancelled' (cancelled orders), 'any' (all orders regardless of status).
Default is 'open'.

limit.description:
Maximum number of orders to return in a single response. Must be between 1 and 250 for performance optimization.
Examples: 10 (small batch), 50 (default), 250 (maximum).
Default is 50.

fields.description:
Specific order fields to include in each response object. Reduces payload size when only certain data is needed.
Examples: ['id', 'order_number', 'total_price'] (basic info), ['id', 'line_items', 'financial_status'] (detailed order data), ['created_at', 'total_price', 'currency'] (financial summary).
Default is None (all available fields).

created_at_min.description:
Filter orders created after this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
Examples: '2024-01-01T00:00:00Z', '2024-01-01T00:00:00+00:00', '2023-12-01T00:00:00-05:00'.
Default is None (no lower date limit).

created_at_max.description:
Filter orders created before this date. Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
Examples: '2024-12-31T23:59:59Z', '2024-12-31T23:59:59+00:00', '2024-01-31T23:59:59-05:00'.
Default is None (no upper date limit).

financial_status.description:
Filter orders by their payment and financial processing status.
Examples: 'pending' (awaiting payment), 'paid' (fully paid), 'partially_paid' (partial payment received), 'refunded' (payment returned), 'voided' (payment cancelled).
Default is None (no financial status filtering).

since_id.description:
Return only orders with IDs greater than this value for offset-based pagination. Useful for retrieving orders in batches.
Examples: '450789469', 'order_123456', '1073339462'.
Default is None (start from beginning).

list_products.name: list_products
list_products.description:
Retrieves a list of products with comprehensive filtering and pagination support.

This function provides access to the store's product catalog with extensive filtering capabilities
including collection membership, date ranges, product types, and field selection. Supports
real-world pagination through since_id and multi-currency pricing information.

collection_id.description:
Return products belonging to a specific product collection ID.
Supports both manual collections (explicit product lists) and smart collections (rule-based
automatic inclusion based on product attributes like type, vendor, tags, etc.).
Example: 'coll_1001'

created_at_max.description:
Return products created before a specified date (ISO 8601 format).
Example: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00'

created_at_min.description:
Return products created after a specified date (ISO 8601 format).
Example: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00'

fields.description:
A list of field names to retrieve for each product. 
Available fields include: admin_graphql_api_id, body_html, created_at, handle, id, image, 
images, options, product_type, published_at, published_scope, status, tags, template_suffix, 
title, updated_at, variants, vendor. If None or empty, all available fields are returned.
Example: ['id', 'title', 'product_type']

handle.description:
A list of product handles to retrieve. Handles are human-friendly
unique strings used in URLs and themes.

ids.description: A list of product IDs to retrieve. Useful for fetching specific products.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 250.

presentment_currencies.description:
A list of ISO 4217 currency codes to return 
presentment prices in. When provided, each variant will include a 'presentment_prices' array
with currency-specific pricing. Supported currencies: USD, EUR, GBP, CAD, AUD, JPY.
Example: ['USD', 'EUR', 'CAD']

product_type.description: Filter products by product type. Case-insensitive matching.

published_at_max.description:
Return products published before a specified date (ISO 8601 format).
Example: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00'

published_at_min.description:
Return products published after a specified date (ISO 8601 format).
Example: '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00'

since_id.description:
Return only products after the specified ID. Essential for cursor-based
pagination in production environments. Products are sorted by ID for consistent pagination.

create_order.name: create_order
create_order.description:
Creates an order with comprehensive customer, financial, and inventory management.

This endpoint creates complete orders with detailed line items, customer linking, address management, 
financial processing including gift card payments, and inventory control. The system supports both 
existing and new customer creation, automatic transaction processing, and flexible inventory behavior 
policies for different fulfillment scenarios.

billing_address.description: Customer's billing address dict with keys:

currency.description:
Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code for order pricing.
    Examples: "USD", "EUR", "GBP", "CAD". Defaults to shop's default currency.

customer.description: Customer information for order association dict with keys:

id.description: Existing customer ID to link order to. Takes precedence over other fields.

email.description: Customer email - creates new customer if no ID provided

first_name.description: Customer's first name - for new customer creation

last_name.description: Customer's last name - for new customer creation

discount_codes.description: Order-level discount codes array, each dict with keys:

email.description: Customer email for order - used when customer object not provided or lacks email

financial_status.description:
Order payment status override.
    Options: "pending", "authorized", "partially_paid", "paid", "partially_refunded", "refunded", "voided"
    Default: Automatically derived from transaction amounts and total price

inventory_behaviour.description:
Inventory management policy for order fulfillment.
    "bypass": Skip inventory checks and updates (default)
    "decrement_ignoring_policy": Reduce inventory regardless of stock levels
    "decrement_obeying_policy": Reduce inventory only if sufficient stock available

line_items.description: Order items array, each dict with keys:

variant_id.description: Product variant ID to order. Required if product_id not provided.

product_id.description: Product ID - uses first variant if variant_id not specified.

quantity.description: Number of units to order. Must be positive integer.

price.description: Override price per unit as decimal string. Uses variant price if not provided.

title.description: Override line item display name. Uses variant/product title if not provided.

total_discount_amount.description:
Total discount for entire line (not per unit) as decimal string.
        Example: "10.00" for $10 total discount on this line item.

note.description: Internal order note or special instructions

send_fulfillment_receipt.description: Whether to send shipping confirmation email. Default: False.

send_receipt.description: Whether to send order confirmation email. Default: False.

shipping_address.description: Customer's shipping address dict with keys:

shipping_lines.description: Shipping method charges array, each dict with keys:

title.description: Shipping method name (e.g., "Standard Shipping", "Express")

tags.description: Comma-separated tags string for order categorization and filtering

tax_lines.description: Tax charges array, each dict with keys:

title.description: Tax name (e.g., "State Tax", "VAT")

transactions.description: Payment transactions array, each dict with keys:

status.description: Transaction status - "success", "pending", "failure", "error"

gateway.description:
Payment gateway identifier - "manual", "gift_card", "shopify_payments", etc.
        Note: For gift card payments, use gateway="gift_card" - system automatically validates
        and deducts from customer's gift card balance

order.description: Complete order creation object with all order details and configuration.

reopen_order.name: reopen_order
reopen_order.description:
Re-opens a closed order.

This function re-opens a previously closed order. It takes the ID of the
closed order as input. Upon successful execution, it returns a dictionary
containing the updated order details, reflecting its reopened status.

order_id.description: The ID of the closed order to re-open. This is a path parameter.

list_orders.name: list_orders
list_orders.description: Retrieves a list of orders that meet the specified criteria. Note: This endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header.

attribution_app_id.description: (Optional) Show orders attributed to a certain app, specified by the app ID. Set as 'current' to show orders for the app currently consuming the API.

created_at_max.description: (Optional) Show orders created at or before this date (ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00').

created_at_min.description: (Optional) Show orders created at or after this date (ISO 8601 format, e.g., '2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00').

fields.description: (Optional) A list of field names to retrieve for each order. These will be sent as a comma-separated string to the API.

financial_status.description: (Optional) Filter orders by their financial status. Common values include: 'pending', 'authorized', 'paid', 'partially_paid', 'refunded', 'voided', 'partially_refunded', 'any', 'unpaid'. Default: 'any'.

fulfillment_status.description: (Optional) Filter orders by their fulfillment status. Common values include: 'shipped', 'partial', 'unshipped', 'any', 'fulfilled'. Default: 'any'.

ids.description: (Optional) A list of order IDs to retrieve. These will be sent as a comma-separated string to the API.

limit.description: (Optional) The maximum number of results to show on a page. Must be less than or equal to 250. Default: 50.

name.description: (Optional) Filter orders by name (e.g., '#1001').

processed_at_max.description: (Optional) Show orders imported or processed at or before this date (ISO 8601 format).

processed_at_min.description: (Optional) Show orders imported or processed at or after this date (ISO 8601 format).

since_id.description: (Optional) Show orders after the specified order ID. (Note: Cursor-based pagination via Link headers is generally preferred).

status.description: (Optional) Filter orders by their status. Default: 'open'. Valid: "open", "closed", "cancelled", "any".

updated_at_max.description: (Optional) Show orders last updated at or before this date (ISO 8601 format).

updated_at_min.description: (Optional) Show orders last updated at or after this date (ISO 8601 format).
