count_orders.name: count_orders
count_orders.description:
Retrieve the total number of orders that meet the specified criteria.

Retrieves the total number of orders that meet the specified criteria.
Filters can be applied based on creation date, update date, financial
status, fulfillment_status, and overall order status.

created_at_max.description:
Count orders created at or before this date
(ISO 8601 format). Defaults to None.

created_at_min.description:
Count orders created at or after this date
(ISO 8601 format). Defaults to None.

financial_status.description:
Filter count by financial status.
Common values include: 'pending', 'authorized', 'paid',
'partially_paid', 'refunded', 'voided', 'partially_refunded',
'any', 'unpaid'. Defaults to 'any'.

fulfillment_status.description:
Filter count by fulfillment status.
Common values include: 'shipped', 'partial', 'unshipped', 'any',
'fulfilled'. Defaults to 'any'.

status.description:
Filter count by order status. Common values
include: 'open', 'closed', 'any'. Defaults to 'open'.

updated_at_max.description:
Count orders last updated at or before
this date (ISO 8601 format). Defaults to None.

updated_at_min.description:
Count orders last updated at or after
this date (ISO 8601 format). Defaults to None.

get_product_by_id.name: get_product_by_id
get_product_by_id.description:
Retrieves a specific product by its ID.

This function retrieves detailed information for a single product identified by its unique `product_id`.
An optional list of `fields` can be provided to limit the data returned for the product; these
fields are sent as a comma-separated string to the API.

product_id.description: The ID of the product to retrieve. This is a path parameter.

fields.description:
(Optional) A list of fields to retrieve for the product.
These will be sent as a comma-separated string to the API. Defaults to None.

create_an_order_transaction.name: create_an_order_transaction
create_an_order_transaction.description:
This function creates a new transaction for a specified order. This can be used to record

payments (such as 'sale' or 'capture') or authorizations. The details of the transaction,
including its kind, amount, and optionally the gateway, are provided within the `transaction`
dictionary.

The function performs comprehensive financial validation including: validates capture amounts 
against authorization limits, prevents over-refunding by checking transaction history, enforces 
proper transaction state transitions (e.g., can't void captured authorizations), automatically 
updates order financial status based on transaction outcomes, and manages customer gift card 
balance updates for manual gateway refunds (gift card refunds automatically credit the customer's 
gift card balance).

order_id.description: The ID of the order for which to create a transaction. This is a path parameter.

gateway.description:
(Optional for some kinds like capture/void if parent_id is used)
    The payment gateway used. For manual payments, can be 'manual'.

parent_id.description:
(Optional) The ID of an existing transaction to explicitly
    void or capture.

currency.description:
(Optional) The currency (ISO 4217 format) of the transaction.
    Defaults to order currency.

test.description: (Optional) Whether this is a test transaction. Default: false.

authorization.description:
(Optional) The authorization code, for external gateways
    when kind is 'sale' or 'authorization'.

target_payment_method_id.description: (Optional) The ID of the target payment method for cross-payment method refunds.

transaction.description:
The transaction object to be created. This dictionary can include
various fields as defined by the Shopify Transaction API. Key fields include:

get_order_by_id.name: get_order_by_id
get_order_by_id.description: Retrieves an order by specifying the ID. All fields of an order are returned unless specific fields are named.

order_id.description: The ID of the order to retrieve. This is a path parameter.

fields.description:
(Optional) A list of field names to retrieve for the order. 
If omitted or an empty list, all fields are returned. Defaults to None.

create_draft_order.name: create_draft_order
create_draft_order.description:
Creates a new draft order with comprehensive line items, customer data, and pricing calculations.

This function creates a complete draft order by processing line items, customer information, 
shipping and billing addresses, applied discounts, and shipping details. The system automatically 
calculates subtotals, applies line-item and order-level discounts, computes tax amounts, and 
generates the final total price. When a variant_id is provided, product details are automatically 
retrieved from the database, while custom line items can be created using title and price. 
Customer data can reference existing customers by ID or create new customer records as needed. 
The function handles complex discount logic including percentage and fixed-amount discounts at 
both line-item and order levels, ensuring accurate pricing calculations throughout the process.

line_items.description:
A list of line item objects that define
    the products or services in the draft order. Each line item is a dictionary that 
    requires either a variant_id for existing products or both title and price for 
    custom items. Line items support the following structure:

variant_id.description:
The unique identifier of an existing product variant.
        When provided, product details are automatically retrieved from the database.

product_id.description:
The unique identifier of the parent product.
        Used in conjunction with custom line items.

quantity.description: The number of units for this line item. Must be a positive integer.

title.description:
The display name for custom line items.
        Required when variant_id is not provided.

price.description:
The unit price for custom line items as a decimal string.
        Required when variant_id is not provided.

sku.description: The stock keeping unit identifier for inventory tracking.

grams.description: The weight of the line item in grams for shipping calculations.

requires_shipping.description:
Whether this item needs physical shipping.
        Defaults to True for most items.

taxable.description:
Whether this item is subject to tax calculations.
        Defaults to True for most items.

applied_discount.description:
A discount specific to this line item.
        When provided, must include both value and value_type fields:

title.description: A descriptive name for the discount.

value.description: The discount amount as a decimal string.

value_type.description:
Either "fixed_amount" for dollar amounts or "percentage"
            for percentage-based discounts.

custom_attributes.description:
Additional metadata for the
        line item as key-value pairs. Each dictionary must contain both 'key' and 'value' fields.

customer.description:
Customer information for the draft order.
    Can reference an existing customer by ID or provide new customer data:

id.description:
The unique identifier of an existing customer.
        When provided, existing customer data is used.

email.description: The customer's email address for new customer records.

first_name.description: The customer's first name for new customer records.

last_name.description: The customer's last name for new customer records.

phone.description: The customer's phone number for contact purposes.

shipping_address.description: The delivery address for the draft order:

address2.description: Secondary address line for apartment or suite numbers.

city.description: City name for the shipping destination.

billing_address.description:
The billing address for payment processing.
    Uses the same structure as shipping_address with identical field definitions.

email.description:
Primary email address for the draft order.
    This is used when no customer object is provided or when the customer object lacks an email.

note.description: Internal notes or comments about the draft order for reference purposes.

tags.description: Comma-separated tags for categorizing and organizing draft orders.

title.description: The name of the shipping method (e.g., "Standard Shipping").

price.description: The shipping cost as a decimal string.

applied_discount.description: Order-level discount applied to the entire draft order:

title.description: A descriptive name for the discount.

description.description: Additional details about the discount promotion.

value.description: The discount amount as a decimal string.

value_type.description:
Either "fixed_amount" for dollar discounts or "percentage"
        for percentage-based discounts.

draft_order.description:
The complete draft order object to be created. 
This dictionary must contain the structural data for creating a comprehensive draft order.

list_draft_orders.name: list_draft_orders
list_draft_orders.description:
Retrieves a filtered list of draft orders with support for pagination and field selection.

This function fetches draft orders from the system with comprehensive filtering options including 
date ranges, specific IDs, status filtering, and field selection. Supports pagination via since_id 
and limit parameters for efficient data retrieval. When fields parameter is provided, only specified 
fields are returned to optimize response size. Returns draft orders sorted by ID for consistent pagination.

fields.description:
Specific fields to include in each draft order for optimized payload size.
When provided, only these fields are returned instead of complete draft order data.
Examples: ['id', 'status', 'total_price'] (basic info), ['customer', 'line_items', 'total_price'] (detailed).
Default is None (returns all available fields).

limit.description:
Maximum number of draft orders to return in a single response.
Must be between 1 and 250 inclusive for optimal performance.
Examples: 10 (small batches), 50 (default), 250 (maximum bulk retrieval).
Default is 50.

since_id.description:
Return draft orders with IDs greater than this value for pagination.
Used for offset-based pagination through large result sets.
Examples: 1001 (continue from draft order 1001), None (start from beginning).
Default is None (no pagination offset).

updated_at_min.description:
Include draft orders last updated at or after this timestamp.
Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
Examples: '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z', '2024-01-01T00:00:00-05:00'.
Default is None (no minimum date filter).

updated_at_max.description:
Include draft orders last updated at or before this timestamp.
Must be in ISO 8601 format with timezone information.
Examples: '2023-12-31T23:59:59Z', '2024-01-01T23:59:59-05:00'.
Default is None (no maximum date filter).

ids.description:
Specific draft order IDs to retrieve for targeted data access.
When provided, only draft orders with these IDs are returned.
Examples: ['D101', 'D102'], ['12345', '67890'].
Default is None (no ID filtering).

status.description:
Filter draft orders by their current status for workflow management.
Valid values: 'open', 'invoice_sent', 'completed'.
Examples: 'open' (draft orders ready for editing), 'completed' (finalized orders).
Default is None (all statuses included).

list_addresses.name: list_addresses
list_addresses.description:
Retrieves a paginated list of addresses for a specific customer with efficient offset-based navigation.

This endpoint fetches all addresses associated with a customer account, providing comprehensive address 
information including shipping and billing details. The function implements offset-based pagination using 
since_id for efficient navigation through large address collections. Each address includes complete 
geographic and contact information, making it suitable for order processing, shipping calculations, and 
customer profile management. The pagination system sorts addresses lexicographically by ID to ensure 
consistent ordering across requests, while the limit parameter allows control over response size for 
optimal performance in different integration scenarios.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the customer whose addresses should be retrieved. 
Must be a non-empty string representing a valid customer ID in the system.
Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123', '1073339462'.

limit.description:
The maximum number of address records to return in a single response. 
Must be an integer between 1 and 250 inclusive. Controls pagination batch size for 
efficient data transfer and processing.
Examples: 10 (small batches), 50 (default balanced size), 250 (maximum bulk retrieval).
Default is 50.

since_id.description:
The pagination offset identifier for retrieving subsequent pages of addresses. 
When provided, only addresses with string IDs lexicographically greater than str(since_id) are returned. 
This enables consistent pagination through the complete address collection.
Examples: 0 (start from beginning), 12345 (continue from address ID 12345).
Default is 0 (no pagination offset).

get_address.name: get_address
get_address.description:
Retrieves a specific customer address using customer ID and address ID.

This function fetches a single address from a customer's address collection. You need both the 
customer ID and the specific address ID to retrieve the address. Returns complete address 
details including contact information and geographic data.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the customer who owns the address. 
Must be a non-empty string. Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123'.

address_id.description:
The unique identifier of the specific address to retrieve. 
Must be a non-empty string. Examples: 'addr_12345', '987654321'.

add_address.name: add_address
add_address.description:
Creates a new address for an existing customer.

This function adds a new address to a customer's address collection. The address requires 
four mandatory fields (address1, city, country, zip) and supports optional fields for 
complete address information. The new address is automatically assigned a unique ID and 
set as non-default. Returns the complete created address with all provided and generated fields.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the customer to add the address to. 
Must be a non-empty string representing an existing customer.
Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123'.

address1.description:
Primary street address line. Required.
    Examples: '123 Main St', '456 Oak Avenue'.

country.description:
Country name or code. Required.
    Examples: 'United States', 'Canada', 'US', 'CA'.

zip.description:
Postal or ZIP code. Required.
    Examples: '10001', 'M5V 3A8', 'SW1A 1AA'.

address2.description:
Secondary address line for apartment, suite, etc.
    Examples: 'Apt 4B', 'Suite 200', 'Floor 3'.

address.description:
The address data to create. Must include required fields 
and can include optional fields for complete address information:

update_address.name: update_address
update_address.description:
Updates an existing customer address with partial field modifications.

This function modifies specific fields of an existing address within a customer's address collection. 
Only the fields you provide in the address parameter will be updated - other fields remain unchanged. 
The system prevents modification of protected fields (id, customer_id, default) to maintain data integrity. 
Returns the complete updated address with all current field values.

customer_id.description:
The unique identifier of the customer whose address is being updated.
Must be a non-empty string representing an existing customer.
Examples: '207119551', 'cust_abc123'.

address_id.description:
The unique identifier of the specific address to update.
Must be a non-empty string representing an existing address for this customer.
Examples: 'addr_12345', '987654321'.

address1.description:
Primary street address line.
    Examples: '456 New Road', '789 Updated Ave'.

country.description:
Country name or code.
    Examples: 'United States', 'Canada', 'US'.

address.description:
Dictionary containing the fields to update. Only provided fields will be modified.
Cannot include protected fields: 'id', 'customer_id', 'default'.
Updatable fields include:

close_order.name: close_order
close_order.description:
Closes an order.

Closes an order. A closed order is one that has no more work to be done. All items have been fulfilled or refunded.

order_id.description: The ID of the order to close. This is a path parameter.

get_draft_order_by_id.name: get_draft_order_by_id
get_draft_order_by_id.description:
Retrieves a specific draft order using its unique identifier.

This function fetches a complete draft order by ID with optional field filtering to reduce response size. 
When fields parameter is provided, only the specified fields are returned. Otherwise, the complete 
draft order with all available data is returned including pricing, customer info, line items, and status.

draft_order_id.description:
The unique identifier of the draft order to retrieve.
Must be a non-empty string representing an existing draft order.
Examples: 'D101', '12345', 'draft_abc123'.

fields.description:
Specific fields to include in the response for optimized payload size.
When provided, only these fields will be returned instead of the complete draft order.
Examples: ['id', 'status', 'total_price'] (basic info), ['customer', 'line_items'] (detailed data).
Default is None (returns all available fields).

create_return.name: create_return
create_return.description:
Initiates a return for one or more line items on an order.

Creates a Return object and associated ReturnLineItem objects for items that have been 
fulfilled but need to be returned. Validates return eligibility by checking fulfillment 
status, existing return quantities, and order state to ensure proper inventory tracking.

cancel_order.name: cancel_order
cancel_order.description:
Cancels an order and optionally processes refunds and restocking.

Permanently closes the order and marks it as cancelled. Can simultaneously
process refunds using either simple amount/currency parameters or detailed
refund objects for complex scenarios involving specific line items.

order_id.description: The ID of the order to cancel.

amount.description: Refund amount as decimal string. Superseded by refund object.

currency.description: Currency code for refund. Required if amount specified.

email.description: Whether to send cancellation email to customer.

restock.description: Whether to restock all items. Overridden by refund line item settings.

update_draft_order.name: update_draft_order
update_draft_order.description:
Updates an existing draft order with the provided fields.

Modifies details like line items, customer information, addresses, and other attributes
for an existing draft order. Only non-read-only fields can be updated.

draft_order_id.description: The ID of the draft order to update.

customer_id.description: ID of the customer associated with the draft order

email.description: Customer's email address

note.description: Optional note attached to the draft order

tags.description: Comma-separated list of tags for filtering and searching

tax_exempt.description: Whether taxes are exempt for the draft order

billing_address.description: Billing address dict with same keys as shipping_address

line_items.description: Product line items array, each dict contains:

title.description: Product or item title

applied_discount.description: Line item discount dict with string values

title.description: Shipping method name

customer.description: Customer information dict (alternative to customer_id) with keys:

id.description: Customer's unique identifier

email.description: Customer's email address

title.description: Discount name

value.description: Original discount value

draft_order.description: Draft order object containing fields to update.

create_exchange.name: create_exchange
create_exchange.description:
Creates an exchange for items in an existing order.

Creates an Exchange object that allows customers to return fulfilled items and receive 
different items in return. Automatically calculates price differences, processes inventory 
adjustments, and completes the exchange immediately. Validates exchange eligibility by 
checking order status, fulfillment status, and inventory availability.

fulfillment_line_item_id.description: ID of the original order line item to exchange.

return_line_items.description: Items to be returned, each containing:

variant_id.description: ID of the product variant to receive.

product_id.description: ID of the product to receive.

title.description: Custom title for the item.

price.description: Custom price for the item as decimal string.

new_line_items.description: New items to receive, each containing:

restock_returned_items.description: Whether to restock the returned items (default: True).

search_products.name: search_products
search_products.description:
Search products with comprehensive filtering and sorting capabilities.

This function provides advanced product search functionality with support for text search,
tag filtering, price ranges, inventory levels, and multiple sorting options. Designed for
real-world e-commerce scenarios where customers need to find products based on specific
attributes and criteria.

query.description:
Text search query to match against product title, body_html, 
tags, vendor, and product_type. Case-insensitive partial matching.

tags.description:
List of tags that products must have. Products must 
contain ALL specified tags (AND logic). Tags are matched case-insensitively.

product_type.description: Filter by product type. Case-insensitive exact match.

vendor.description: Filter by vendor name. Case-insensitive exact match.

status.description: Filter by product status. Valid values: "active", "archived", "draft".

published_scope.description: Filter by published scope. Valid values: "web", "global".

price_min.description:
Minimum price filter. Searches across all product variants.
Format: decimal string (e.g., "10.00", "99.99").

price_max.description:
Maximum price filter. Searches across all product variants.
Format: decimal string (e.g., "100.00", "999.99").

inventory_quantity_min.description: Minimum total inventory quantity across all variants.

inventory_quantity_max.description: Maximum total inventory quantity across all variants.

created_at_min.description:
Filter products created after this date.
Format: ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z").

created_at_max.description:
Filter products created before this date.
Format: ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., "2023-12-31T23:59:59Z").

updated_at_min.description:
Filter products updated after this date.
Format: ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., "2023-01-01T00:00:00Z").

updated_at_max.description:
Filter products updated before this date.
Format: ISO 8601 timestamp (e.g., "2023-12-31T23:59:59Z").

variant_query.description:
Text search query to match against variant titles, SKUs, 
and option values. Case-insensitive partial matching. Useful for finding specific 
product variations like "clicky switches" or "Google Home compatible".

variant_sku.description:
Filter products that have variants with matching SKU.
Case-insensitive partial matching.

variant_title.description:
Filter products that have variants with matching title.
Case-insensitive partial matching.

variant_option1.description:
Filter products that have variants with matching option1 value.
Case-insensitive partial matching. Common for size, color, material, etc.

variant_option2.description:
Filter products that have variants with matching option2 value.
Case-insensitive partial matching. Common for secondary attributes.

variant_option3.description:
Filter products that have variants with matching option3 value.
Case-insensitive partial matching. Common for tertiary attributes.

fields.description:
List of fields to include in response. If not specified,
returns all product fields. Valid fields include: id, title, body_html, vendor,
product_type, handle, status, tags, variants, options, images, etc.

limit.description: Maximum number of products to return. Range: 1-250. Default: 50.

sort_by.description:
Field to sort results by. Valid values:
- "title": Sort by product title
- "created_at": Sort by creation date
- "updated_at": Sort by last update date
- "price": Sort by lowest variant price
- "inventory_quantity": Sort by total inventory quantity
- "vendor": Sort by vendor name
- "product_type": Sort by product type
Default: "id" (product ID).

run_command.name: run_command
run_command.description:
Executes the provided terminal command in the current workspace context.

Use this function to run shell commands. You need to provide the exact
command string to be executed. Note that commands like 'cd', 'pwd', and
environment commands ('export', 'unset', 'env') are handled internally;
other commands are executed externally and may modify the workspace files.

IMPORTANT: For any command that expects user interaction or uses a pager
(like git diff, git log, less, head, tail, more, etc.), you MUST append
' | cat' to the command string yourself before passing it to this function.
Failure to do so will cause the command to hang or fail.

For commands that are intended to run for a long time or indefinitely
(e.g., starting a server, running a watch process), set the
`is_background` parameter to True.

command.description:
The exact terminal command string to execute. Remember
to append ' | cat' for interactive/pager commands.

is_background.description:
Set to True to run the command as a
background process (e.g., for servers or watchers). Defaults to False,
running the command in the foreground and waiting for completion.

list_tables.name: list_tables
list_tables.description:
List all tables in the BigQuery database.

This function lists all tables in the BigQuery database by loading the JSON DB file
and processing its contents. It returns a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary
represents a table. Each dictionary contains specific details for a table: its unique
identifier ('table_id'), the identifier of the dataset containing it ('dataset_id'),
the identifier of the project containing it ('project_id'), the table's type (e.g.,
'TABLE', 'VIEW', 'MATERIALIZED_VIEW'), the Unix timestamp (milliseconds) of its
creation, and an optional Unix timestamp (milliseconds) for its expiration.

describe_table.name: describe_table

table_name.description: The name of the table for which to retrieve schema information.

execute_query.name: execute_query
execute_query.description: Execute a SELECT query on the BigQuery database.

query.description: The SQL query to execute.

documentId.description: The ID of the document to retrieve. Cannot be empty or whitespace.

suggestionsViewMode.description:
The mode for viewing suggestions.
Common values include "DEFAULT" and "SUGGESTIONS_INLINE". 
If None, the document's existing setting is preserved.

includeTabsContent.description: Whether to include tab content. Defaults to False.

userId.description:
The ID of the user performing the action. Defaults to "me".
Cannot be empty or whitespace.

title.description: The title of the document. Defaults to "Untitled Document".

userId.description:
The ID of the user. Defaults to "me".
Must be a non-empty string.

batch_update_document.name: batch_update_document
batch_update_document.description: Apply batch updates to a document.

documentId.description: The ID of the document to update.

text.description: The text to insert.

index.description:
The zero-based index in the document's content
                           where the text will be inserted.

location.description: Specifies where to insert the text.

documentStyle.description:
The new document style to apply. The specific
                               structure of this dictionary will depend on how
                               document styles are defined in your system.

requests.description:
A list of update requests to apply. Each dictionary
in the list must be one of the specified request types. Each request
dictionary typically has a single key identifying the type of request
(e.g., 'insertText'), and its value is a dictionary containing the
parameters for that request. The supported request types and their
structures are:
- InsertTextRequest: Corresponds to a dictionary with an 'insertText' key.

userId.description: The ID of the user. Defaults to "me".

copy_file.name: copy_file
copy_file.description: Creates a copy of a file if quota allows.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to copy. Must be a non-empty string.

name.description: Name of the copied file. If not provided, defaults to "Copy of {original_file_name}".

parents.description: List of parent folder IDs. If not provided, inherits from original file.

permissions.description: List of permission objects. Each permission object may include the following fields:

id.description: Permission ID.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission. Allowed values:
        - 'viewer': Can view the file
        - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
        - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file
        - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee. Allowed values:
        - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
        - 'group': Permission granted to a group
        - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
        - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group.

domain.description: The domain name of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire, in RFC 3339 format.

body.description: Dictionary of file properties with keys:

ignoreDefaultVisibility.description: Whether to ignore default visibility set by domain administrators. Defaults to False.

keepRevisionForever.description: Whether to keep revision forever. Defaults to False.

ocrLanguage.description: The language to use for OCR. Defaults to empty string.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include. Defaults to empty string.

includeLabels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string.

create_file_or_folder.name: create_file_or_folder
create_file_or_folder.description: Creates a new file or folder with permissions if quota allows.

name.description: Name of the file.

mimeType.description:
MIME type of the file. Can be:
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.document'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.spreadsheet'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.presentation'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.drawing'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'
    - 'application/vnd.google-apps.script'

size.description: File size in bytes (string that must be convertible to integer).

id.description: Permission ID

permissions.description: List of permission objects with keys:

body.description: Dictionary of file properties with keys:

md5Checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the file content.

sha1Checksum.description: SHA1 checksum of the file content.

sha256Checksum.description: SHA256 checksum of the file content.

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file content.

filePath.description: Path to file for content upload.

media_body.description: Dictionary containing media content properties with keys:

enforceSingleParent.description: Whether to enforce single parent. Defaults to False.

ignoreDefaultVisibility.description: Whether to ignore default visibility. Defaults to False.

keepRevisionForever.description: Whether to keep revision forever. Defaults to False.

ocrLanguage.description: The language to use for OCR. Defaults to empty string.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

useContentAsIndexableText.description: Whether to use content as indexable text. Defaults to False.

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include. Defaults to empty string.

includeLabels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string.

delete_file_permanently.name: delete_file_permanently
delete_file_permanently.description: Permanently deletes a file owned by the user without moving it to trash.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to delete.

enforceSingleParent.description: Whether to enforce single parent. Defaults to False.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

empty_files_from_trash.name: empty_files_from_trash
empty_files_from_trash.description: Permanently deletes all of the trashed files owned by the user.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive to empty trash from.

export_google_doc.name: export_google_doc
export_google_doc.description: Exports a Google Doc to the requested MIME type and returns binary content.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to export. Must be a non-empty string.

mimeType.description: The MIME type to export to. Must be a non-empty string.

generate_file_ids.name: generate_file_ids
generate_file_ids.description: Generates a set of file IDs.

space.description: The space in which the IDs can be used.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to retrieve.

list_user_files.name: list_user_files
list_user_files.description: Lists the user's files with support for Shared Drives, ordering, and pagination.

corpora.description:
Comma-separated list of corpora. Defaults to 'user', which means
only files owned by or shared with the user will be returned.

driveId.description:
ID of the shared drive to search. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no specific drive filtering is applied.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description:
Whether to include items from all drives.
Defaults to False, meaning only items from the user's My Drive are included.

includeTeamDriveItems.description:
Whether to include team drive items.
Defaults to False, meaning team drive items are excluded.

orderBy.description:
Sort order for the results. Defaults to 'folder,modifiedTime desc,name',
which means:
- Folders are listed first
- Then files are sorted by modified time in descending order (newest first)
- Finally, items with the same modified time are sorted by name

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of files to return. Must be a positive integer.
Defaults to 10, meaning at most 10 files will be returned per page.

pageToken.description:
Token for the next page of results. Defaults to empty string,
meaning the first page of results will be returned.

q.description:
Query string for filtering files. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no filtering is applied. The query string should follow the format: `field operator value`.
Logical Operators:
Multiple conditions can be combined using `and` and `or` logical operators.
For example, `name = 'file.txt' and trashed = False or mimeType = 'image/jpeg'`
is processed as `(name = 'file.txt' and trashed = False) or (mimeType = 'image/jpeg')`.
Parentheses for explicitly grouping conditions (e.g., `A and (B or C)`) are not supported.
not supported by the current parser. To achieve a query like `A and (B or C)`,
you must write it in disjunctive normal form: `(A and B) or (A and C)`.
For instance:
`(name contains 'report' and mimeType = 'application/pdf') or (name contains 'report' and mimeType = 'text/plain')`
Supported Operators:
   - `=`: Equals. For exact matches.
   - `!=`: Not equals.
   - `contains`: Checks if the field's string representation contains the given value.
   (e.g., `name contains 'report'`).
   - `<`: Less than. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `<=`: Less than or equal to. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `>`: Greater than. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `>=`: Greater than or equal to. Used for numeric or date/time fields.
   - `in`: Checks if a specific string value is present within a list-like field (e.g., `parents`).
   The syntax is `'stringValue' in fieldName`.
   For example, `'folderId123' in parents` checks if `'folderId123'`
   is one of the IDs in the `parents` list of a file.
Value Types:
   - Strings: Must be enclosed in single (`'`) or double (`"`) quotes
   (e.g., `name = 'My Document.pdf'` or `description = "Final Report"`).
   - Booleans: Use `True` or `False` (case-insensitive)
   (e.g., `trashed = False` or `starred = True`).
   - Date/Timestamps: For fields like `modifiedTime` or `createdTime`.
   Values should be in a standard date/time format that can be parsed
   (e.g., ISO 8601 format like `'2023-10-26T10:00:00Z'`).
Filterable Fields:
You can attempt to filter on any field present in the file resource dictionary.
Common fields include:

spaces.description:
Comma-separated list of spaces to search. Defaults to 'drive',
which means only files in the user's Drive will be returned.

supportsAllDrives.description:
Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False,
meaning shared drive operations are not supported.

supportsTeamDrives.description:
Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False,
meaning team drive operations are not supported.

teamDriveId.description:
ID of the team drive to search. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no specific team drive filtering is applied.

includePermissionsForView.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions to include.
Defaults to empty string, meaning no additional permissions are included.

includeLabels.description:
Comma-separated list of labels to include. Defaults to empty string,
meaning no label filtering is applied.

update_file_metadata_or_content.name: update_file_metadata_or_content
update_file_metadata_or_content.description:
Updates a file's metadata or content with patch semantics. 

This means only the fields explicitly provided in the `body` dictionary
will be updated. All other file properties will remain unchanged.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to update.

name.description: New name of the file.

mimeType.description: New MIME type of the file.

parents.description: New list of parent folder IDs.

body.description: Dictionary of file properties to update with keys:

md5Checksum.description: MD5 checksum of the file content.

sha1Checksum.description: SHA1 checksum of the file content.

sha256Checksum.description: SHA256 checksum of the file content.

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file content.

filePath.description: Path to file for content upload (creates new revision).

media_body.description: Dictionary containing media content properties to update with keys:

addParents.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to add, defaults to ''.

enforceSingleParent.description: Whether to enforce single parent, defaults to False.

removeParents.description: Comma-separated list of parent IDs to remove, defaults to ''.

subscribe_to_file_changes.name: subscribe_to_file_changes
subscribe_to_file_changes.description: Subscribes to changes to a file.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to watch.

id.description: Channel ID.

body.description: Dictionary of watch properties with keys:

includePermissionsForView.description: Specifies which additional view's permissions to include.

includeLabels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to include.

create_shared_drive.name: create_shared_drive
create_shared_drive.description:
Creates a shared drive. If requestId is provided, it's used as the drive's ID and for idempotency.

Otherwise, an internal ID is generated.

requestId.description:
An ID, such as a random UUID. If provided, this ID is used
as the drive's ID. If a drive with this ID already exists,
it is returned. If None or empty, an internal ID is
generated for a new drive.

name.description: The name of the shared drive.

restrictions.description: A dictionary of restrictions to apply to the drive, with keys:

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs.

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

themeId.description: The ID of the theme to apply to this shared drive.

body.description: Dictionary of drive properties. Valid keys:

delete_shared_drive.name: delete_shared_drive
delete_shared_drive.description:
Permanently deletes a shared drive for which the user is an organizer.

This function permanently removes a shared drive from the user's account. The drive
must be identified by its unique `driveId`. For the operation to succeed, the user
must have the appropriate permissions (e.g., be an organizer) for the specified drive.
Once deleted, the drive and all of its contents are irretrievably lost.

driveId.description: The unique identifier of the shared drive to be deleted.

get_shared_drive_metadata.name: get_shared_drive_metadata
get_shared_drive_metadata.description: Gets a shared drive's metadata by ID.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive.

hide_shared_drive.name: hide_shared_drive
hide_shared_drive.description: Hides a shared drive from the default view.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive to hide. Must be a non-empty string.

list_user_shared_drives.name: list_user_shared_drives
list_user_shared_drives.description:
Lists the user's shared drives.

This function returns a list of shared drives that the user is a member of.
It supports filtering by drive properties through the `q` parameter
and allows for pagination using `pageSize` and `pageToken`.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of shared drives to return per page.
Must be an integer between 1 and 100.

q.description:
Query string for searching shared drives. 
The query supports the following fields and operators:
    - Fields: 'name', 'id', 'createdTime', 'hidden', 'themeId'
    - Operators: =, !=, <, <=, >, >=, contains, in
You can combine conditions with 'and' and 'or'.
String values must be quoted. Example queries:
    "name = 'My Drive'"
    "name contains 'Project' and hidden = false"
    "createdTime >= '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z'"
    "name = 'Team Drive' or themeId = 'blue-theme'"

pageToken.description: (Optional) A base64-encoded token for pagination. The token encodes a JSON object with:

unhide_shared_drive.name: unhide_shared_drive
unhide_shared_drive.description: Restores a shared drive to the default view.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive.

update_shared_drive_metadata.name: update_shared_drive_metadata
update_shared_drive_metadata.description:
Updates the metadata for a shared drive.

This function modifies an existing shared drive's metadata based on the
provided `body`. The drive is identified by its `driveId`.

driveId.description: The ID of the shared drive.

name.description: The name of the shared drive.

adminManagedRestrictions.description: Whether administrative privileges on this shared drive are required to modify restrictions.

copyRequiresWriterPermission.description: Whether the options to copy, print, or download files inside this shared drive, should be disabled for readers and commenters.

domainUsersOnly.description: Whether access to this shared drive and items inside this shared drive is restricted to users of the domain to which this shared drive belongs.

driveMembersOnly.description: Whether access to items inside this shared drive is restricted to its members.

hidden.description: Whether the shared drive is hidden from default view.

themeId.description: The ID of the theme to apply to this shared drive.

body.description: Dictionary of drive properties to update with keys:

create_file_comment.name: create_file_comment
create_file_comment.description:
Creates a body on a file.

This function creates a new body on the specified Google Drive file with
input validation and error handling.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to comment on.

content.description: The plain text content of the comment.

emailAddress.description: Valid email address of the author.

value.description: The quoted content text (required if quotedFileContent provided).

mimeType.description: MIME type of the quoted content (required if quotedFileContent provided).

resolved.description: Whether the comment is resolved (defaults to False).

body.description:
Dictionary containing comment properties. If None,
an empty dictionary is used. Supported keys:

fileId.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

commentId.description: The ID of the comment to get.

fileId.description: The ID of the file to list comments for. Cannot be empty.

includeDeleted.description:
Whether to include deleted comments.
If False, deleted comments are excluded from the response. Defaults to False.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of comments to return per page.
Must be between 1 and 100, inclusive. Defaults to 20.

pageToken.description:
Page token for continuing a previous list request.
Provides the starting point for pagination. Expected to be an integer string if provided.
Defaults to an empty string.

startModifiedTime.description:
The start time to filter comments by.
Only comments modified on or after this timestamp are returned.
Format: RFC 3339 timestamp (e.g., '2023-01-01T00:00:00Z').
Defaults to an empty string (no time filter).

update_file_comment.name: update_file_comment
update_file_comment.description: Updates a comment with patch semantics.

fileId.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

commentId.description: The ID of the comment to update.

displayName.description: The display name of the author.

emailAddress.description: The email address of the author.

author.description: Dictionary of author information with keys:

value.description: The quoted content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the quoted content.

quotedFileContent.description: Dictionary of quoted content with keys:

anchor.description: The anchor point of the comment.

resolved.description: Whether the comment has been resolved.

body.description: Dictionary of comment properties to update with keys:

delete_file_comment.name: delete_file_comment
delete_file_comment.description:
Deletes a comment from a file in Google Drive.

This function permanently removes a comment from a file. The comment is
identified by its `commentId` and the `fileId` of the file it is associated
with. If the comment does not exist or the provided IDs are incorrect,
an error will be raised.

fileId.description: The ID of the file the comment belongs to.

commentId.description: The ID of the comment to delete.

get_drive_account_info.name: get_drive_account_info
get_drive_account_info.description:
Gets information about the user's Drive account.

This function retrieves account information for the authenticated user
from the Google Drive API. The response can be filtered to include
only specific fields using the fields parameter.

fields.description:
A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.
Use '*' to include all fields (default).
For partial responses, use comma-separated field names (e.g., 'user,storageQuota').
For nested fields, use dot notation (e.g., 'user.displayName,storageQuota.limit').
Field names are case-sensitive and whitespace around commas is ignored.

create_permission.name: create_permission
create_permission.description: Creates a permission for a file or shared drive.

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission, defaults to 'reader' (alias for 'viewer'). Possible values:
    - 'viewer': Can view the file
    - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
    - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file
    - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee, defaults to 'user'. Possible values:
    - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
    - 'group': Permission granted to a group
    - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
    - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group to grant the permission to. This will be normalized to lowercase.

domain.description: The domain name (e.g. 'example.com') of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search, defaults to False.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire, in RFC 3339 format. Example: `'2025-06-30T12:00:00Z'` (UTC) or `'2025-06-30T08:00:00-04:00'`.

body.description: Dictionary of permission properties with keys:

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

permissionId.description: The ID of the permission to delete.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether to support all drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description: Whether to support team drives. Defaults to False.

useDomainAdminAccess.description: Whether to use domain admin access. Defaults to False.

get_permission.name: get_permission
get_permission.description:
Gets a permission by ID.

Retrieves a specific permission by its ID for the specified file. The function
supports various access patterns including shared drives and domain admin access.

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive. Must be a non-empty string.

permissionId.description: The ID of the permission to retrieve. Must be a non-empty string.

supportsAllDrives.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both My Drives 
and shared drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description:
Whether to support team drives. Deprecated - use 
supportsAllDrives instead. Defaults to False.

useDomainAdminAccess.description:
Issue the request as a domain administrator. If set to 
true, grants access if the file ID refers to a shared drive and the requester 
is an administrator of the domain to which the shared drive belongs. Defaults to False.

list_permissions.name: list_permissions
list_permissions.description: Lists a file's or shared drive's permissions.

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

supportsAllDrives.description: Whether to support all drives. If True, includes permissions from all drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description: Whether to support team drives. If True, includes team drive specific permissions. Defaults to False.

useDomainAdminAccess.description: Whether to use domain admin access. If True, includes domain-wide permissions. Defaults to False.

update_permission.name: update_permission
update_permission.description: Updates a permission with patch semantics.

fileId.description: The ID of the file or shared drive.

permissionId.description: The ID of the permission to update.

role.description:
The role granted by this permission. Possible values:
    - 'viewer': Can view the file, (alias for 'reader')
    - 'commenter': Can view and comment on the file
    - 'editor': Can view, comment, and edit the file (alias for 'writer')
    - 'owner': Has full control over the file

type.description:
The type of the grantee. Possible values:
    - 'user': Permission granted to a specific user
    - 'group': Permission granted to a group
    - 'domain': Permission granted to a domain
    - 'anyone': Permission granted to anyone with the link

emailAddress.description: The email address of the user or group.

domain.description: The domain name of the entity this permission refers to.

allowFileDiscovery.description: Whether the permission allows the file to be discovered through search.

expirationTime.description: The time at which this permission will expire.

body.description: Dictionary of permission properties to update with keys:

transferOwnership.description: Whether to transfer ownership to the specified user and downgrade the current owner to a writer.

appId.description: The ID of the app to retrieve.

list_installed_apps.name: list_installed_apps
list_installed_apps.description:
Lists a user's installed apps.

This function retrieves all installed apps for the current user and applies
optional filtering based on file extensions and MIME types. The languageCode
parameter is accepted for API compatibility but does not affect the current
implementation.

appFilterExtensions.description:
A comma-separated list of file extensions 
to filter by (e.g., "pdf,txt,docx"). Only apps that support these extensions
will be returned. Defaults to '' (no filtering).

appFilterMimeTypes.description:
A comma-separated list of MIME types to 
filter by (e.g., "text/plain,application/pdf"). Only apps that support 
these MIME types will be returned. Defaults to '' (no filtering).

languageCode.description:
The language code to use for localized strings.
Currently unused but accepted for API compatibility. Defaults to ''.

stop_channel_watch.name: stop_channel_watch
stop_channel_watch.description: Stops watching resources through this channel.

id.description: The ID of the channel to stop.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource being watched.

resourceUri.description: The URI of the resource being watched.

token.description: The token used to authenticate the channel.

expiration.description: The time at which the channel will expire (RFC3339 format).

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered.

payload.description: Whether to include the payload in notifications.

resource.description:
Dictionary of channel properties. 
If None or empty dictionary, no action is taken. Required key:

get_changes_start_page_token.name: get_changes_start_page_token
get_changes_start_page_token.description:
Gets the starting pageToken for listing future changes.

This method retrieves a starting page token that can be used to list changes
to files in a user's Drive or a shared drive. The page token doesn't expire
and should be stored for subsequent change tracking operations.

driveId.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which the starting 
pageToken for listing future changes will be returned. Must be a valid 
shared drive ID if provided. Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

supportsAllDrives.description:
Whether the requesting application 
supports both My Drives and shared drives. When True, enables access 
to shared drive content. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives 
instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version. Defaults to False.

teamDriveId.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. 
This parameter will be removed in a future version. Defaults to empty string.

list_changes.name: list_changes
list_changes.description:
Lists the changes for a user or shared drive.

This method retrieves a list of changes that have occurred since the specified 
page token. Changes include file additions, modifications, deletions, and 
permission changes.

pageToken.description:
The token for continuing a previous list request on the next page.
This token is obtained from a previous changes.list request or from 
changes.getStartPageToken(). Cannot be empty.

driveId.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which changes are returned.
Only changes to files within this shared drive will be returned.
Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

includeCorpusRemovals.description:
Whether changes should include the file resource 
if the file is still accessible by the user at the time of the request.
Defaults to False.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description:
Whether both My Drive and shared drive items 
should be included in results. Defaults to False.

includeRemoved.description:
Whether to include changes indicating that items have 
been removed from the list of changes. Defaults to True.

includeTeamDriveItems.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use includeItemsFromAllDrives 
instead. Whether to include changes for team drive items. Defaults to False.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of changes to return per page. Must be between 
1 and 1000 inclusive. Defaults to 100.

restrictToMyDrive.description:
Whether to restrict the results to changes inside 
the My Drive hierarchy. This cannot be used together with teamDriveId or driveId.
Defaults to False.

spaces.description:
A comma-separated list of spaces to query within the user corpus.
Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder', and 'photos'. Defaults to 'drive'.

supportsAllDrives.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both 
My Drives and shared drives. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives instead.
Whether the requesting application supports Team Drives. Defaults to False.

teamDriveId.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. The ID of the Team Drive 
for which changes will be returned. Defaults to empty string.

includePermissionsForView.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions 
to include in the response. Only 'published' is supported. Defaults to empty string.

includeLabels.description:
A comma-separated list of IDs of labels to include in 
the labelInfo part of the response. Defaults to empty string.

watch_changes.name: watch_changes
watch_changes.description:
Creates a simulated notification channel for watching changes in Google Drive.

This function simulates setting up a watch channel for changes to files in 
a user's Drive or shared drive. In the simulation, it stores the channel 
configuration and validates the watch parameters, but does not establish 
actual real-time notifications.

pageToken.description:
The token for the initial page of changes to watch from.
This token is obtained from changes.getStartPageToken() or a previous 
changes.list request. Cannot be empty.

id.description: Required. Unique identifier for the channel.

address.description: Required. URL where notifications are delivered.

resourceId.description: Optional. ID of the resource being watched.

resourceUri.description: Optional. URI of the resource being watched.

token.description: Optional. Token for authenticating the channel.

expiration.description: Optional. Expiration time in RFC 3339 format.

payload.description: Optional. Whether to include payload in notifications.

resource.description:
Dictionary of notification channel 
properties. If None, a minimal channel will be created. Expected keys:

driveId.description:
The ID of the shared drive for which changes are watched.
Only changes to files within this shared drive will trigger notifications.
Defaults to empty string (user's My Drive).

includeCorpusRemovals.description:
Whether the watch should include notifications 
for files that are removed from the corpus but still accessible.
Defaults to False.

includeItemsFromAllDrives.description:
Whether to watch changes in both My Drive 
and shared drives. Defaults to False.

includeRemoved.description:
Whether to include notifications for removed items.
Defaults to True.

includeTeamDriveItems.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use includeItemsFromAllDrives 
instead. Whether to include changes for team drive items. Defaults to False.

pageSize.description:
Maximum number of changes to return per notification. 
Must be between 1 and 1000 inclusive. Defaults to 100.

restrictToMyDrive.description:
Whether to restrict notifications to changes 
inside the My Drive hierarchy only. Cannot be used with driveId or teamDriveId.
Defaults to False.

spaces.description:
A comma-separated list of spaces to watch for changes.
Supported values are 'drive', 'appDataFolder', and 'photos'. Defaults to 'drive'.

supportsAllDrives.description:
Whether the requesting application supports both 
My Drives and shared drives. Required when driveId is specified. Defaults to False.

supportsTeamDrives.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use supportsAllDrives instead.
Whether the application supports Team Drives. Defaults to False.

teamDriveId.description:
**DEPRECATED** - Use driveId instead. The ID of the Team Drive 
to watch for changes. Defaults to empty string.

includePermissionsForView.description:
Specifies which additional view's permissions 
to include in change notifications. Only 'published' is supported. 
Defaults to empty string.

includeLabels.description:
A comma-separated list of label IDs to include in 
the labelInfo part of change notifications. Defaults to empty string.

create_comment_reply.name: create_comment_reply
create_comment_reply.description: Creates a reply to a comment.

fileId.description: The ID of the file.

photoLink.description: A link to the author's profile photo.

body.description: Dictionary containing the reply details with keys:

fileId.description: The ID of the file.

replyId.description: The ID of the reply to delete.

get_comment_reply.name: get_comment_reply
get_comment_reply.description:
Gets a reply by ID from a comment on a file.

This function retrieves a specific reply to a comment on a Google Drive file.
Deleted replies are excluded by default unless explicitly requested.

fileId.description: The ID of the file.

replyId.description: The ID of the reply to retrieve.

includeDeleted.description:
Whether to include deleted replies in the response.
Defaults to False. When False, deleted replies return None.

fileId.description: The ID of the file. Must not be empty.

commentId.description: The ID of the comment. Must not be empty.

includeDeleted.description: Whether to include deleted replies. Defaults to False.

pageSize.description: Maximum number of replies to return per page. Must be positive. Defaults to 20.

pageToken.description: Token for the next page of results. Defaults to an empty string.

fileId.description: The ID of the file.

replyId.description: The ID of the reply to update.

content.description: The updated content of the reply.

photoLink.description: A link to the author's profile photo.

author.description: Updated information about the author with keys:

body.description: Dictionary containing the updated reply details with keys:

get_file_content.name: get_file_content
get_file_content.description:
Get file content, optionally for a specific revision.

This function retrieves the content of a file, optionally for a specific revision.
If a revision ID is provided, it searches the file's revisions list for the matching
revision and returns its content. If no revision ID is provided, it returns the current
content of the file.

user_id.description: The ID of the user retrieving the file content.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to retrieve content from.

revision_id.description: Optional revision ID to get specific revision.

create_file_revision.name: create_file_revision
create_file_revision.description:
Create a new revision for a file.

This function creates a new revision for a file with the given content. It
generates a unique revision ID based on the existing revisions in the file's
data structure, creates a revision content structure matching the expected
JSON format, and validates the revision using the RevisionModel. The function
then adds the revision to the file's revisions list.

user_id.description: The ID of the user creating the revision.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to which the revision is being added.

content.description: The content to be added to the revision.

update_file_content.name: update_file_content
update_file_content.description:
Update file content with new bytes data.

This function updates the content of a file with new bytes data. It calculates
a new checksum for the new content, encodes it to base64, and creates a new
content structure matching the expected JSON format. The function then validates
the new content using the FileContentModel and creates a new revision before
updating the file's content and size. Finally, it clears the export cache since
the content has changed.

user_id.description: The ID of the user updating the file content.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to which content is being updated.

new_content.description: The new content to be added to the file.

export_file_content.name: export_file_content
export_file_content.description:
Export file content to a different format.

This function exports the content of a file to a different format. It checks
if the export is cached and returns the cached content if available. If not,
it decodes the current content, validates the export format, and exports the
content to the target MIME type. Finally, it caches the exported content and
returns the exported content.

user_id.description: The ID of the user exporting the file content.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to export content from.

target_mime.description: The target MIME type for export.

list_file_revisions.name: list_file_revisions
list_file_revisions.description:
List all revisions for a file.

This function retrieves all revisions for a file. It returns the file's revisions
list, which is a list of dictionaries containing the revision information.

user_id.description: The ID of the user retrieving the revisions.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to retrieve revisions from.

list_activities.name: list_activities
list_activities.description:
Retrieves a list of activities with optional filters.

This method allows fetching activities from YouTube based on various criteria such as
channel ID, publication date range, and region code. Activities represent various
actions that occur on YouTube, such as uploads, likes, comments, etc.

part.description:
The part parameter specifies the activity resource properties that
the API response will include.

channelId.description:
The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID.
The API will only return that channel's activities.

mine.description:
Set this parameter's value to true to retrieve a feed of
the authenticated user's activities.

maxResults.description:
The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number
of items that should be returned in the result set.

pageToken.description:
The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in
the result set that should be returned.

publishedAfter.description:
The publishedAfter parameter specifies the earliest
date and time that an activity could have occurred.

publishedBefore.description:
The publishedBefore parameter specifies the latest
date and time that an activity could have occurred.

regionCode.description:
The regionCode parameter instructs the API to select a
video chart available in the specified region.

list_video_categories.name: list_video_categories
list_video_categories.description: Retrieves a list of video categories with optional filters.

part.description: The part parameter specifies the videoCategory resource properties that the API response will include.

hl.description: The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata for a specific application language that the YouTube website supports. Currently unused!

id.description: The id parameter identifies the video category that is being retrieved.

region_code.description: The regionCode parameter instructs the API to select a video category available in the specified region.

max_results.description: The maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set.

part.description:
The part parameter specifies the commentThread resource properties
that the API response will include. Currently, only "snippet" is supported.

snippet.description:
The snippet object contains details about the comment thread.
This is treated as arbitrary thread metadata.

top_level_comment.description:
The top-level comment for the thread.
If provided, it's expected to be a dictionary
potentially containing an 'id' (str) key.

list_comment_threads.name: list_comment_threads
list_comment_threads.description: Retrieves a list of comment threads with optional filters.

part.description: The part parameter specifies the commentThread resource properties that the API response will include. Cannot be empty.

thread_id.description: The id parameter identifies the comment thread that is being retrieved.

channel_id.description: The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID. The API will only return that channel's comment threads.

video_id.description: The videoId parameter identifies the video for which the API should return comment threads.

all_threads_related_to_channel_id.description: The allThreadsRelatedToChannelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID. The API will return all comment threads related to that channel.

search_terms.description: The searchTerms parameter specifies the search terms to use when filtering comment threads.

moderation_status.description: The moderationStatus parameter specifies the moderation status of comments to include in the response.

order.description: The order parameter specifies the order in which the API response should list comment threads.

max_results.description: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set. Must be a positive integer if provided.

page_token.description: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned.

text_format.description: The textFormat parameter specifies the format of the text in the comments.

delete_comment_thread.name: delete_comment_thread
delete_comment_thread.description: Deletes a comment thread by its ID.

thread_id.description: The ID of the comment thread to delete.
The ID of the comment thread to update.

snippet.description: The snippet object contains details about the comment thread.

comments.description: A list of comment IDs associated with the thread.

list_searches.name: list_searches
list_searches.description: Returns a collection of search results that match the query parameters.

part.description: The part parameter specifies a comma-separated list of one or more search resource properties.

q.description: The query term to search for.

channel_id.description: Filter results to only contain resources created by the specified channel.

channel_type.description: Filter results to only contain channels of a particular type.

max_results.description: The maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set.

order.description: The order in which to sort the returned resources.

type.description: A comma-separated list of resource types that should be included in the search response.

video_caption.description: Filter videos based on the presence, absence, or type of captions.

video_definition.description: Filter videos by definition (high or standard).

video_embeddable.description: Filter videos that can be embedded.

list_channel_sections.name: list_channel_sections
list_channel_sections.description: Retrieves a list of channel sections with optional filters.

part.description:
The part parameter specifies the channelSection resource properties that the API response will include.
It should be a comma-separated string of valid parts (e.g., "id,snippet,contentDetails").
At least one specified part must be valid. An empty string, a string consisting only of
commas/whitespace, or a string with no valid parts after parsing will raise an error.

channel_id.description:
The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID.
The API will only return that channel's sections.

hl.description:
The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata
for a specific application language that the YouTube website supports.

section_id.description:
The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube channel section ID(s)
for the resource(s) that are being retrieved. This is expected as a single string.
The original core logic appears to treat this as a single ID for filtering if provided,
rather than parsing a list of IDs from this string.

mine.description:
The mine parameter can be used to instruct the API to only return channel sections
owned by the authenticated user.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description:
The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's
authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting
on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value.

delete_channel_section.name: delete_channel_section
delete_channel_section.description: Deletes a channel section from the simulated database.

section_id.description: The unique identifier of the channel section to delete.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description: Content owner ID for CMS user operations.

part.description: The part parameter specifies the channelSection resource properties that the API response will include.

snippet.description: The snippet object contains details about the channel section.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value. Currently not used!

on_behalf_of_content_owner_channel.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which the user is being added. Currently not used!

part.description: The part parameter specifies the channelSection resource properties that the API response will include.

section_id.description: The ID of the channel section to update.

snippet.description: The snippet object contains details about the channel section.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value. Currently not used !

list_channels.name: list_channels
list_channels.description: Retrieves a list of channels with optional filters.

category_id.description:
The categoryId parameter specifies a YouTube guide category ID.
The API response will only include channels from that category.

for_username.description:
The forUsername parameter specifies a YouTube username.
The API response will only include the channel associated with that username.

hl.description:
The hl parameter instructs the API to retrieve localized resource metadata
for a specific application language that the YouTube website supports.

channel_id.description:
The id parameter specifies a comma-separated list of the YouTube channel ID(s)
for the resource(s) that are being retrieved.

managed_by_me.description:
The managedByMe parameter can be used to instruct the API
to only return channels that the user is allowed to manage.

max_results.description:
The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items
that should be returned in the result set. Must be between 1 and 50.

mine.description:
The mine parameter can be used to instruct the API to only return
channels owned by the authenticated user.

my_subscribers.description:
The mySubscribers parameter can be used to instruct the API
to only return channels to which the authenticated user has subscribed.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description:
The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the
request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user
who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified
in the parameter value.

for_username.description: The forUsername parameter specifies a YouTube username for the new channel.

managed_by_me.description: The managedByMe parameter indicates whether the channel is managed by the authenticated user.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value.

has_access_to_level.description: The hasAccessToLevel parameter specifies the membership level that the member has access to.

filter_by_member_channel_id.description: The filterByMemberChannelId parameter specifies a comma-separated list of YouTube channel IDs. The API will only return memberships from those channels.

mode.description: The mode parameter specifies the membership mode.

snippet.description: The snippet object containing membership details.

my_rating.description: Set this parameter to retrieve a list of videos that match the criteria specified by the myRating parameter value.

page_token.description: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned.

manage_channel_comment_count.name: manage_channel_comment_count
manage_channel_comment_count.description: Retrieves or sets the number of comments for the channel.

comment_count.description:
If provided, sets the comment count to this value.

video_count.description:
