list_subscriptions.description: Retrieves a list of subscriptions with optional filters.

part.description: The part parameter specifies the subscription resource properties that the API response will include.

channel_id.description: The channelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID. The API will only return that channel's subscriptions.

subscription_id.description: The id parameter identifies the subscription that is being retrieved.

mine.description: The mine parameter can be used to instruct the API to only return subscriptions owned by the authenticated user.

my_recent_subscribers.description: The myRecentSubscribers parameter can be used to instruct the API to only return subscriptions to the authenticated user's channel from the last 30 days.

my_subscribers.description: The mySubscribers parameter can be used to instruct the API to only return subscriptions to the authenticated user's channel.

for_channel_id.description: The forChannelId parameter specifies a YouTube channel ID. The API will only return subscriptions to that channel.

max_results.description: The maxResults parameter specifies the maximum number of items that should be returned in the result set.

on_behalf_of_content_owner.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwner parameter indicates that the request's authorization credentials identify a YouTube CMS user who is acting on behalf of the content owner specified in the parameter value.

on_behalf_of_content_owner_channel.description: The onBehalfOfContentOwnerChannel parameter specifies the YouTube channel ID of the channel to which the user is being added.

order.description: The order parameter specifies the order in which the API response should list subscriptions.

page_token.description: The pageToken parameter identifies a specific page in the result set that should be returned.

create_presentation.name: create_presentation
create_presentation.description:
Create a new Google Slides presentation.

This function creates a new Google Slides presentation using the provided title.
An initial blank slide is typically created with the presentation.

title.description: The title of the presentation.

get_presentation.name: get_presentation
get_presentation.description:
Get details about a Google Slides presentation.

This function retrieves details about a Google Slides presentation. The
`presentationId` argument specifies which presentation to fetch. An optional
`fields` argument can be used as a mask to specify which parts of the
presentation data should be included in the response, allowing for more
targeted data retrieval.

presentationId.description: The ID of the presentation to retrieve.

fields.description:
Optional. A mask specifying which fields to include
in the response (e.g., 'slides,pageSize').

batch_update_presentation.name: batch_update_presentation
batch_update_presentation.description:
Apply a batch of updates to a Google Slides presentation.

This function applies a series of specified update operations to a Google Slides
presentation in a single batch request. It allows for various modifications
such as creating slides, adding shapes, inserting text, deleting objects,
updating styles, and managing object groups, as defined by the list of `requests`.

presentationId.description: The ID of the presentation to update.

objectId.description:
A user-supplied object ID. If specified,
            must be unique (5-50 chars, pattern [a-zA-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_-:]*).
            If empty, a unique ID is generated.

insertionIndex.description:
Optional zero-based index where to
            insert the slides. If unspecified, created at the end.

slideLayoutReference.description:
Layout reference
            of the slide. If unspecified, uses a predefined BLANK layout.
            One of 'predefinedLayout' or 'layoutId' must be provided if
            'slideLayoutReference' itself is provided.

layoutId.description:
Layout ID of one of the layouts in
                the presentation.

placeholderIdMappings.description:
Optional list
            of object ID mappings from layout placeholders to slide placeholders.
            Used only when 'slideLayoutReference' is specified. Each item is a
            dictionary:

objectId.description:
User-supplied object ID for the new
                placeholder on the slide (5-50 chars, pattern
                [a-zA-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_-:]*). If empty, a unique ID is generated.

layoutPlaceholder.description:
The placeholder on a
                layout to be applied to a slide.

type.description:
The type of the placeholder. Enum: ["TITLE",
                    "BODY", "CENTERED_TITLE", "SUBTITLE", "DATE_AND_TIME",
                    "FOOTER", "HEADER", "OBJECT", "CHART", "TABLE", "CLIP_ART",
                    "PICTURE", "SLIDE_IMAGE", "SLIDE_NUMBER"].

index.description: The index of the placeholder. Usually 0.

layoutPlaceholderObjectId.description:
The object ID of the
                placeholder on a layout.

objectId.description:
Optional user-supplied object ID for the
            shape (5-50 chars, pattern [a-zA-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_-:]*).
            If empty, a unique ID is generated.

pageObjectId.description:
The object ID of the page where
                the element is located.

size.description: The size of the page element.

transform.description:
The transform of the
                page element.

shapeType.description:
The type of shape to create. Enum:
            ["TYPE_UNSPECIFIED", "TEXT_BOX", "RECTANGLE", "ROUND_RECTANGLE",
            "ELLIPSE", "ARC", "BENT_CONNECTOR_2", "BENT_CONNECTOR_3",
            "BENT_CONNECTOR_4", "BENT_CONNECTOR_5", "CURVED_CONNECTOR_2",
            "CURVED_CONNECTOR_3", "CURVED_CONNECTOR_4", "CURVED_CONNECTOR_5",
            "LINE", "STRAIGHT_CONNECTOR_1", "TRIANGLE", "RIGHT_TRIANGLE",
            "PARALLELOGRAM", "TRAPEZOID", "DIAMOND", "PENTAGON", "HEXAGON",
            "HEPTAGON", "OCTAGON", "STAR_5", "ARROW_EAST", "ARROW_NORTH_EAST",
            "ARROW_NORTH", "SPEECH", "CLOUD", "NOTCHED_RIGHT_ARROW"].

objectId.description: Object ID of the shape or table.

cellLocation.description:
Optional table cell
            location if inserting into a table.

text.description: The text to insert.

insertionIndex.description:
Optional 0-based index where text
            will be inserted in Unicode code units.

insertText.description: Inserts text into a shape or table cell.

replaceText.description: The text that will replace matched text.

text.description: The text to search for.

matchCase.description:
Indicates if the search should be
                case sensitive. Defaults to False.

searchByRegex.description:
Optional. True if the find value
                should be treated as a regular expression. Defaults to False.

pageObjectIds.description:
Optional. Limits matches to
            page elements only on the given page IDs.

replaceAllText.description: Replaces all instances of specified text.

objectId.description: Object ID of the page or page element to delete.

deleteObject.description: Deletes a page or page element.

objectId.description: Object ID of the shape or table.

startIndex.description:
Optional 0-based start index for
                FIXED_RANGE and FROM_START_INDEX.

textRange.description: The range of text to delete.

deleteText.description: Deletes text from a shape or table cell.

objectId.description: Object ID of the shape or table with the text to be styled.

strikethrough.description: Whether the text is struck through.

magnitude.description: The magnitude of the font size.

unit.description: The unit of the font size. Enum: ["PT"].

foregroundColor.description:
Color of the text.
                Structure defined by Google Slides API OptionalColor.

textRange.description: The range of text to style.

fields.description:
Field mask (e.g., 'bold,fontSize') specifying which
            style fields to update. Use '*' for all fields.

updateTextStyle.description:
Updates the styling of text within a
        Shape or Table.

groupObjectId.description:
Optional user-supplied ID for the
            new group (5-50 chars, pattern [a-zA-Z0-9_][a-zA-Z0-9_-:]*).

childrenObjectIds.description:
Object IDs of the page elements to
            group (at least 2, on the same page, not already in another group).

objectIds.description:
Object IDs of the groups to ungroup (at least 1).
            Groups must not be inside other groups and all on the same page.

objectId.description: Object ID of the page element.

title.description:
Optional. The new alt text title. If unset,
            existing value is maintained.

description.description:
Optional. The new alt text description.
            If unset, existing value is maintained.

updatePageElementAltText.description: Updates alt text of a page element.

masterObjectId.description: The object ID of the master slide.

layoutObjectId.description: The object ID of the layout slide.

isSkipped.description:
Whether the slide is skipped in
                show mode.

notesPage.description:
Notes page properties.
                Structure defined by Google Slides API NotesPage.

fields.description:
Field mask (e.g., 'isSkipped,notesPage.notesPageProperties')
            specifying which slide properties to update. Use '*' for all.

requests.description:
A list of update requests to apply. Each object
in the array must be one of the specified request types. Each request
object typically has a single key identifying the type of request (e.g.,
'createSlide'), and its value is a dictionary containing the parameters
for that request. The supported request types and their structures are:
- CreateSlideRequest: Corresponds to a dictionary with a 'createSlide' key.

requiredRevisionId.description:
The revision ID of the presentation
    required for this update. If the current revision is different, the
    request will fail.

writeControl.description:
Optional. Provides control over how
write requests are executed.

get_page.name: get_page
get_page.description:
Get details about a specific page (slide) in a presentation.

This function gets details about a specific page (slide) in a presentation.

pageObjectId.description: The object ID of the page (slide) to retrieve.

summarize_presentation.name: summarize_presentation
summarize_presentation.description:
Extract text content from all slides in a presentation for summarization purposes.

This function processes a presentation, identified by `presentationId`, to extract
all text content from its slides. The primary purpose of this extraction is to
gather text for summarization. If the `include_notes` parameter is set to true,
speaker notes associated with the slides are also included in the extracted content.
The function returns a dictionary detailing the extracted text, including the
presentation's ID, a list of text elements per slide (with optional speaker notes),
and a fully concatenated string of all text suitable for summarization.

presentationId.description: The ID of the presentation to summarize.

include_notes.description: Whether to include speaker notes in the summary (default: False).

switch_connection.name: switch_connection
switch_connection.description:
Switch to a different MongoDB connection.

Switches to a different MongoDB connection. If the user has configured a
connection string or has previously called the connect tool, a connection
is already established, and there is no need to call this function unless
the user has explicitly requested to switch to a new instance. Options for
switching the current MongoDB connection can be provided via the
`connectionString` parameter. If a `connectionString` argument is not
supplied, the function will attempt to use a connection string from the
existing configuration.

connectionString.description:
MongoDB connection string to switch to
(in the mongodb:// or mongodb+srv:// format). Defaults to None,
in which case a default connection string will be used.

list_databases.name: list_databases
list_databases.description: List all databases for a MongoDB connection.

drop_database.name: drop_database
drop_database.description:
Removes the specified database, deleting the associated data files.

This function removes the specified database. In doing so, it deletes
the associated data files.

list_collections.name: list_collections
list_collections.description:
List all collections for a given database.

This function lists all collections for a given database. Collection names
are expected to be strings.

create_collection.name: create_collection
create_collection.description:
Creates a new collection in a database.

This function creates a new collection within the specified database.
If the database does not already exist, it will be created automatically as part of this operation.

rename_collection.name: rename_collection
rename_collection.description:
Renames a collection in a MongoDB database.

This function changes the name of an existing collection within a specified database to a new name.
If a collection with the `newName` already exists, the behavior is controlled by the `dropTarget`
parameter: if `dropTarget` is true, the existing target collection is dropped before the rename;
otherwise, if the target collection exists and `dropTarget` is false, an error is raised.

newName.description: The new name for the collection.

dropTarget.description: If true, drops the target collection if it exists. Defaults to False.

drop_collection.name: drop_collection
drop_collection.description:
Removes a collection or view from the database. The method also removes any indexes associated with the dropped collection.

This function removes a collection or view from the database. The method also removes any indexes associated with the dropped collection.

collection_schema.name: collection_schema
collection_schema.description:
Describe the schema for a collection.

This function describes the schema for a collection. It provides an analysis
of the collection's schema, which is typically derived by sampling
documents within that collection.

collection_storage_size.name: collection_storage_size
collection_storage_size.description:
Gets the size of the collection.

This function gets the size of the collection. It retrieves detailed storage statistics for a specified collection within a database.

collection_indexes.name: collection_indexes
collection_indexes.description:
Describe the indexes for a collection.

This function describes the indexes for a specified collection. It provides
details for each index associated with the collection, such as its version,
the fields it indexes along with their sort order, its unique name, and
its namespace (typically 'database_name.collection_name').

create_index.name: create_index
create_index.description:
Create an index for a collection.

This function creates an index for a specified collection within a given database.
It uses the provided 'database' and 'collection' names, and an index
definition specified by 'keys'. An optional 'name' can be given to the index.

name.description: The name of the index. Defaults to None.

find.name: find
find.description:
Run a find query against a MongoDB collection.

This function executes a find query against a specified MongoDB database and collection.
It allows for filtering documents using a query filter, specifying which fields to
return using a projection, limiting the maximum number of documents returned, and
defining a sort order for the results. The filter, projection, and sort criteria
should match the syntax used in MongoDB's `db.collection.find()` and `cursor.sort()`
methods, respectively.

filter.description:
The query filter, matching the syntax of the
query argument of db.collection.find(). Defaults to None.

projection.description:
The projection, matching the syntax of the
projection argument of db.collection.find(). Defaults to None.

limit.description: The maximum number of documents to return. Defaults to 10.

sort.description:
A document, describing the sort order, matching
the syntax of the sort argument of cursor.sort(). Defaults to None.

count.name: count
count.description:
Gets the number of documents in a MongoDB collection.

This function counts documents in a specified collection of a
MongoDB database. An optional query can be provided to filter
the documents before counting.

query.description:
A filter/query parameter. Allows
users to filter the documents to count. Matches the syntax of
the filter argument of db.collection.count(). If None or
omitted, all documents in the collection are counted.

aggregate.name: aggregate
aggregate.description:
Run an aggregation against a MongoDB collection.

This function runs an aggregation against a specified MongoDB collection within a given database.
It executes an array of aggregation pipeline stages provided as input and returns the
results of this aggregation.

pipeline.description: An array of aggregation stages to execute.

insert_many.name: insert_many
insert_many.description:
Insert an array of documents into a MongoDB collection.

MongoDB typically creates collections automatically during the first insert
operation if they do not already exist, provided the collection name is valid
and permissions allow.

documents.description:
The array of documents to insert.
Each item in the list should be a dictionary representing a
MongoDB document. The list must not be empty as per model validation.

update_many.name: update_many
update_many.description:
Updates all documents that match the specified filter for a collection.

Modifies existing documents in a collection that match the filter
criteria. Optionally, if 'upsert' is true, a new document will be
inserted if no documents match the filter.

update.description:
An update document describing the
modifications to apply using update operator expressions (e.g.,
'$set', '$inc').

filter.description:
The selection criteria for the
update. If None or an empty dictionary, all documents in the
collection are candidates for update. Defaults to None (empty filter).

upsert.description:
Controls whether to insert a new document
if no documents match the filter. Defaults to False.

delete_many.name: delete_many
delete_many.description:
Removes all documents that match the filter from a MongoDB collection.

This function removes all documents that match the specified filter from a MongoDB collection.
It operates on a given database and collection, using a filter query to identify the documents for deletion.

filter.description:
The query filter, specifying the deletion criteria.
Matches the syntax of the filter argument of db.collection.deleteMany(). Defaults to None,
which typically means no filter is applied (behavior might depend on MongoDB driver if filter is truly omitted or passed as empty).

cancel_booking.name: cancel_booking
cancel_booking.description:
Cancels an existing booking.

This function cancels an existing booking. By default, the OAuth consumer must be the booking owner.
Travel Management Companies (TMCs) can cancel on behalf of users when registered with SAP Concur
and possessing appropriate admin roles (Web Services Administrator or Can Administer).
Booking records can only be updated by their original source.

bookingSource.description: Unique supplier identifier configured during SAP Concur application review. Must match the booking's Supplier Name exactly.

confirmationNumber.description: Confirmation number of the booking to be canceled.

userid_value.description: SAP Concur login ID of the booking owner (required only when canceling on behalf of another user). Defaults to None.

get_location_by_id.name: get_location_by_id
get_location_by_id.description:
Retrieves details of a specific location by its ID or UUID.

This function retrieves details of a specific location by its ID or UUID.
It is used when the exact identifier of a Concur location is known.

id.description: Required ID or UUID of the location.

get_trips_summary.name: get_trips_summary
get_trips_summary.description:
Retrieves trip summaries for a user or company.

This function retrieves trip summaries based on specified filter criteria.
It requires the ITINER scope for authorization. To access company-wide trip data
(by setting `userid_value` to 'ALL'), the authenticated user must possess either
'Web Services Administrator' or 'Can Administer' roles. All parameters for filtering
are optional. It is important to note that this function is not recommended for
extracting large volumes of historical data. For comprehensive company-wide data needs,
using Itinerary v4 is advised.

start_date.description: UTC start date for trips (YYYY-MM-DD). Default: today - 30 days. Defaults to None.

end_date.description: UTC end date for trips (YYYY-MM-DD). Default: today + 12 months. Defaults to None.

created_after_date.description: UTC date for trips created on/after (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to None.

created_before_date.description: UTC date for trips created on/before (YYYY-MM-DD). Defaults to None.

last_modified_date.description: UTC last modified date/time of trips (format: date-time). Defaults to None.

booking_type.description: Filter by booking type. Possible values: 'Air', 'Car', 'Dining', 'Hotel', 'Parking', 'Rail', 'Ride'. Defaults to None.

userid_value.description: User's login ID or 'ALL' for company-wide access. Defaults to None(company-wide access).

include_metadata.description: Include paging metadata in response. Defaults to False.

items_per_page.description: Number of items per page (default: 200 if page provided). Defaults to None.

include_virtual_trip.description: 1 to include virtual trips. Possible values: 0, 1. Defaults to None (treated as 0).

include_canceled_trips.description: Include trips with Canceled status. Defaults to False.

include_guest_bookings.description: Include guest bookings. Defaults to False.

create_or_update_booking.name: create_or_update_booking
create_or_update_booking.description:
Creates or updates a booking in SAP Concur.

This function creates a new booking or updates an existing one. It requires
BookingSource and RecordLocator to be provided within the 'booking' dictionary.
If an update operation results in a new confirmation number, any pre-existing
booking associated with the old confirmation number must be explicitly cancelled
by the caller.

RecordLocator.description: Record locator for this booking (6+ alphanumeric characters). (Required)

TextName.description: Full name as entered in booking tool.

DateBookedLocal.description: Booking creation date in local time (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss).

FormOfPaymentName.description: Name of the form of payment.

FormOfPaymentType.description: Type of the form of payment.

Segments.description: Contains travel segments. Keys are segment types ('Car', 'Air', 'Hotel').

Vendor.description: Vendor code for the car rental company.

VendorName.description: Full name of the car rental company.

StartDateLocal.description: Start date of the car rental.

EndDateLocal.description: End date of the car rental.

ConfirmationNumber.description: Confirmation number for the car rental.

Baggage.description: Baggage allowance for the car rental.

weight_kg.description: Weight of the bags in kilograms, defaults to 0.

nonfree_count.description: Number of non-free bags, defaults to 0.

ConfirmationNumber.description: Confirmation number for the hotel stay.

booking.description: A dictionary containing the booking details.

list_locations.name: list_locations
list_locations.description:
Retrieves details of locations valid at the user's company with optional filtering parameters.

This function retrieves details of locations valid at the user's company.
It allows for finding Concur locations by various optional filter
parameters such as name, city, country, country subdivision, or
administrative region.

offset.description: The starting point of the next set of results after the specified limit. Defaults to None.

limit.description: Number of records to return (default: 25). Defaults to None.

name.description: Common name associated with location (e.g., neighborhood, landmark, city). Defaults to None.

city.description: City name of the location. Defaults to None.

countrySubdivision.description: ISO 3166-2 country subdivision code (e.g., US-WA). Defaults to None.

country.description: 2-letter ISO 3166-1 country code (e.g., US). Defaults to None.

administrativeRegion.description: Administrative region (e.g., county). Defaults to None.

update_reservation_baggages.name: update_reservation_baggages
update_reservation_baggages.description: Updates baggage allowance for a booking with payment processing for additional bags.

booking_source.description: The supplier's name that must match the booking.

total_baggages.description: Total number of bags for the booking.

nonfree_baggages.description: Number of bags that require payment.

payment_id.description: ID of the payment method to use. Required if adding paid bags.

update_reservation_flights.name: update_reservation_flights
update_reservation_flights.description:
Updates flight details for a booking, handling multiple flight segments and payment processing.

Note: This function preserves existing baggage information on a segment-by-segment basis.
For flights that match existing flight numbers and dates, the original baggage information
is preserved. For new flights, baggage information from the first original segment is used
as a fallback. To modify baggage information, use the update_reservation_baggages function.

booking_source.description: The supplier's name that must match the booking.

date.description: The date of the flight in ISO format

flights.description:
List of flights to update or add.
Each flight should contain at least:

payment_id.description: ID of the payment method to use for any price differences.

update_reservation_passengers.name: update_reservation_passengers
update_reservation_passengers.description: Updates all passenger information in a booking.

booking_source.description: The supplier's name that must match the booking.

passengers.description:
List of passengers to update.
Each passenger should contain:

search_direct_flight.name: search_direct_flight
search_direct_flight.description:
Searches for direct flights between two airports.

This function searches for direct (non-stop) flights in the SAP Concur system
between the specified departure and arrival airports on a specific date.

departure_airport.description: Three-letter IATA airport code for departure (e.g., "JFK", "LAX").

arrival_airport.description: Three-letter IATA airport code for arrival (e.g., "LAX", "ORD").

departure_date.description:
Departure date filter in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Only flights departing on this date will be returned.

search_onestop_flight.name: search_onestop_flight
search_onestop_flight.description:
Searches for one-stop (connecting) flights between two airports.

This function searches for flights with connections in the SAP Concur system
between the specified departure and arrival airports on a specific date.

departure_airport.description: Three-letter IATA airport code for departure (e.g., "JFK", "LAX").

arrival_airport.description: Three-letter IATA airport code for arrival (e.g., "LAX", "ORD").

departure_date.description:
Departure date filter in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
Only flights departing on this date will be returned.

send_certificate.name: send_certificate
send_certificate.description:
Sends a certificate to a user using the notification infrastructure.

This function issues digital certificates to users for various business activities
such as travel completion, expense approval, or training completion. Certificates
are delivered via the existing notification system and stored as notifications
with certificate-specific context data.

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user to receive the certificate.

certificate_type.description:
Type of certificate to issue. Valid types are:
- "travel_completion": Certificate for completed business travel
- "expense_approval": Certificate for approved expense reports  
- "training_completion": Certificate for completed training
- "refund_voucher": Certificate for refund vouchers issued to users
- "goodwill_gesture": Certificate for goodwill gestures provided to users

amount.description:
Monetary amount associated with the certificate (e.g., trip cost, 
approved expense amount, training cost). Must be non-negative.

trip_id.description:
Trip identifier when certificate is related to a specific trip.
Required for "travel_completion" certificates. Defaults to None.

currency.description:
Currency code for the amount (e.g., "USD", "EUR", "GBP"). 
Defaults to "USD".

get_reservation_details.name: get_reservation_details
get_reservation_details.description:
Retrieves reservation details for a given record locator.

This function finds a booking by its record locator and 
returns the booking data if found.

record_locator.description: The record locator of the booking.

get_user_details.name: get_user_details
get_user_details.description:
Retrieves user details and booking record locators for a given username.

This function searches for a user by their username and returns the
user's data along with their booking record locators, payment methods,
and gift certificates if a match is found.

list_all_airports.name: list_all_airports
list_all_airports.description:
Retrieves a dictionary of all airports with their city.

This function iterates through the locations in the database, filters for those
with a location_type of 'airport', and returns them in a dictionary format.

get_installed_apps.name: get_installed_apps
get_installed_apps.description: Gets the list of installed application on the device.

open_app.name: open_app
open_app.description:
Opens the requested application on the device.

Alternative app names:
 - If the user wants to open "alarms" or "timers" but there is no app with an
   obviously matching name, open any clock app, if present, as a less-preferred fallback.

app_name.description:
The name of the application to open.
This name has to exactly match one of the names produced by `get_installed_apps`.

app_package_name.description: The package name of the application to open.

extras.description:
The extras in json string format to send to the application being opened.
Note:
* This should only be populated when opening "Pixel Screenshots".
* When opening "Pixel Screenshots", always extract the information-seeking part of the user prompt and populate it in the extras field.
* The key of the extras field is "query". The value of the extras field is the query extracted from the user prompt.
* The query should be a full question/sentence, unless the original user prompt is too terse to infer one.

open_camera.name: open_camera
open_camera.description:
Opens the device's camera.

This method allows specifying which camera to use (e.g., front or rear)
and the initial mode it should open in (e.g., photo or video mode).

camera_type.description: The type of camera to open. Can be one of 'FRONT', 'REAR' or 'DEFAULT'.

camera_operation.description: The initial functional mode for the camera upon opening. Can be one of 'PHOTO' or 'VIDEO'.

open_home_screen.name: open_home_screen
open_home_screen.description: Navigates to home screen on the device.

open_url.name: open_url
open_url.description:
Opens the requested url in a browser.

Do not use it unless the user prompt contains a url or explicitly asks to open a website.

url.description:
The URL to open.
Do not include the protocol (e.g. https://) if the user prompt does not include it.

website_name.description: The name of the website to open. Do not include the top-level domain.

open_websearch.name: open_websearch
open_websearch.description: Opens a Google search page with the provided query in the browser (e.g. Chrome).

query.description: The search query to open.

power_off_device.name: power_off_device

execute_sql.name: execute_sql
execute_sql.description:
Executes raw SQL in the Postgres database. Use `apply_migration` instead for DDL operations.

This function simulates PostgreSQL query execution for the Supabase API simulation.
All operations are performed in-memory with no persistence between sessions.

Supported SQL Operations:
- SELECT queries with WHERE, JOIN, GROUP BY, HAVING, ORDER BY, LIMIT
- INSERT statements (single and multiple rows)
- UPDATE statements with WHERE conditions
- DELETE statements with WHERE conditions
- Basic DDL: CREATE TABLE, ALTER TABLE, DROP TABLE
- Transaction commands: BEGIN, COMMIT, ROLLBACK
- Multi-schema support (e.g., public.users, analytics.products)

Supported Data Types:
- Text types: TEXT, VARCHAR, CHAR
- Numeric types: INTEGER, BIGINT, SMALLINT, DECIMAL, NUMERIC, REAL, DOUBLE
- Boolean: BOOLEAN
- Date/Time: DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP, TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE
- UUID (stored as VARCHAR internally)
- JSON/JSONB (stored as JSON)
- SERIAL/BIGSERIAL types (converted to INTEGER/BIGINT, auto-increment not supported)

PostgreSQL Compatibility Notes:
- SERIAL/BIGSERIAL columns are converted to INTEGER/BIGINT (manual ID management required)
- PostgreSQL functions like now() and uuid_generate_v4() are automatically converted
- Foreign key constraints across different schemas are not supported
- Type OIDs in responses are approximated based on common PostgreSQL types

Limitations of this simulation:
- PostgreSQL-specific functions are limited (e.g., array functions, full-text search)
- Advanced features like CTEs and window functions have limited support
- Stored procedures, functions, and triggers are not supported
- PostgreSQL extensions (postgis, pg_trgm, etc.) are not available
- Transaction isolation levels are not enforced
- Constraints are partially supported (PRIMARY KEY works, CHECK constraints work, but foreign keys have limitations)
- No support for COPY, VACUUM, ANALYZE, or other maintenance commands
- Limited support for advanced index types (only basic indexes work)
- Sequences and auto-increment functionality not available
- User-defined types and domains are not supported

project_id.description: The project ID.

query.description: The SQL query to execute.

An empty string "" will generally match all issues.

If provided, only issues matching the JQL will be considered.

Issue type names to filter the results.
If None, all issue types are returned. This parameter accepts a

search_issues_jql.name: search_issues_jql
search_issues_jql.description: Search for issues based on JQL query.

jql.description:
The JQL query to search for issues.
Strings with spaces must be enclosed in single (') or double (") quotes.
Commonly searchable fields include:
- `id` / `key` (e.g., `id = "ISSUE-123"`)
- `project` (e.g., `project = "DEMO"`)
- `summary` (e.g., `summary ~ "critical bug"` or `summary = "Exact phrase"`)
- `description` (e.g., `description ~ "detailed steps"`)
- `priority` (e.g., `priority = "High"`)
- `assignee`:
    - The `assignee` field is stored as a dictionary with a `name` field (e.g., `{"name": "jdoe"}`), but can be queried directly using the username: `assignee = "jdoe"`.
    - The JQL parser automatically extracts the `name` field from the assignee dictionary for comparison.
    - The `name` field corresponds to the user's `name` field from the users table (not email or display name).
    - Dot notation queries (e.g., `assignee.name = "jdoe"`) are **NOT supported** by the current JQL parser.
- `created` (e.g., `created >= "2024-01-01"`)
- `issuetype` (e.g., `issuetype = "Bug"`)
- `status` (e.g., `status = "Open"`)

Supported operators:
- `=` (equals), `!=` (not equals)
- `~` (contains), `!~` (does not contain)
- `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=` (comparison operators for dates/numbers)
- `IN` (e.g., `priority IN ("High", "Critical")`)
- `NOT IN` (e.g., `status NOT IN ("Closed", "Done")`)
- `IS EMPTY`, `IS NOT EMPTY` (for null/empty checks)
- `IS NULL`, `IS NOT NULL` (aliases for empty checks)
- `EMPTY`, `NULL` (legacy empty checks)

Combining conditions:
- Use `AND` and `OR` for multiple conditions (e.g., `project = "WebApp" AND status = "Open" OR priority = "High"`).
- `AND` has higher precedence than `OR`.
- Parentheses `()` for explicit grouping of conditions are supported (e.g., `(project = "WebApp" OR project = "API") AND status = "Open"`).

Ordering results:
- Use `ORDER BY fieldName [ASC|DESC]` (e.g., `ORDER BY created DESC`).

The exact fields and operators supported depend on the JQL parsing and evaluation logic implemented in the simulation.

start_at.description: The index of the first issue to return. Defaults to 0.

max_results.description: The maximum number of issues to return. Defaults to 50.

fields.description: A list of fields to return. Defaults to None (all fields).

expand.description: A list of fields to expand. Defaults to None.

validate_query.description: Whether to validate the JQL query. Defaults to True.

create_project_component.description:

The key of the project where the component will be created.

get_all_dashboards.description:
