create_content.name: create_content
create_content.description:
Creates new content.

This function creates a new content item (page, blogpost, comment, etc.) with the specified
details and stores it in the database. It handles both basic content creation and special
cases like comments with ancestor relationships.

title.description: Content title

spaceKey.description: Space key where content will be created

status.description: Content status (default: 'current')

minorEdit.description: Flag indicating a minor edit (default: False)

body.description: Content body with storage format, structured as:

value.description: The content value in storage format.

postingDay.description: Posting day for blog posts in "YYYY-MM-DD" format

body.description:
Dictionary containing content details
Required fields:

get_content_details.name: get_content_details
get_content_details.description:
Retrieves content by its unique identifier.

This function fetches a content item from the database using its ID. It can optionally
filter the content by its status to ensure the content matches the expected state.

id.description: The unique identifier of the content to retrieve. Must be a non-empty string.

status.description:
The expected status of the content. If provided,
the function will verify that the content's status matches this value.
Must be a string if provided.

update_content.name: update_content
update_content.description:
Updates existing content.

This function updates an existing content item with new values.
Versioning is managed automatically: the version is incremented by one (defaulting to 1 if no version is set).
The update payload should not include a version object (any provided version data is ignored).

Special behavior:
  - **Restoring a trashed page:**
    To restore content that is "trashed", the update request must set its status to "current". In that case,
    only the version is incremented and the status updated to "current". No other fields are modified.
  - **Deleting a draft:**
    If the update is intended to delete a draft (signaled by `query_status="draft"`), then the draft is removed and
    the content's body is replaced with the provided body. (Updating a draft is not supported.)

id.description: ID of the content to update. (Docstring uses 'content_id' but param is 'id')

title.description: New content title.

status.description: New content status.

body.description: New content body.

key.description: Space key.

space.description: New space object containing a "key" field.

body.description:
Dictionary containing updated content details.
Optional fields:

delete_content.name: delete_content
delete_content.description:
Deletes a content item from the system.

This function simulates the deletion of a content item based on its type and status,
following these cases:
  1. If the content is trashable (default) and its status is "current":
     The content is trashed by updating its status to "trashed" (simulating a soft delete).
  2. If the content is trashable, its status is "trashed", and the query parameter "status"
     is set to "trashed":
     The content is purged (permanently deleted) from the database.
  3. If the content is not trashable:
     The content is immediately deleted permanently regardless of its status.

id.description: The unique identifier of the content to delete.

status.description:
The query parameter "status" from the request.
When set to "trashed" in the purge scenario, indicates that the content should be
permanently deleted.

search_content_cql.name: search_content_cql
search_content_cql.description:
Searches for content using Confluence Query Language (CQL) with pagination support.

This function performs a search across all content items using the provided CQL query.
It supports complex queries with logical operators and field comparisons, and returns
paginated results.

cql.description:
The CQL query string to use for searching. The query can include:
- Field comparisons (e.g., "type='page'", "space="TEST"")
- Logical operators (AND, OR, NOT)
- Parentheses for grouping
- Comparison operators (=, !=, >, <, >=, <=, ~, !~)
Allowed fields:
    - Ancestor, Container, Content, Created, Creator, Contributor
    - Favourite/favorite, ID, Label, Last modified, Macro, Mention
    - Parent, Space, Space category, Space key, Space title, Space type
    - Text, Title, Type, Watcher, status

start.description: The starting index for pagination. Defaults to 0. Must be non-negative.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 25. Must be non-negative.

get_content_list.name: get_content_list
get_content_list.description:
Returns a paginated list of content filtered by the specified parameters.

This function retrieves all content from the database and applies filters based
on the provided arguments. The results are paginated using the start and limit parameters.

type.description:
The type of content (e.g., "page", "blogpost", "comment").
Only content matching this type is returned. If None, no filtering is applied.

spaceKey.description:
The key of the space in which the content is located.
Only content in the specified space is returned.

title.description: The title of the content. Filters to content with a matching title. Required if type is "page".

status.description:
The status of the content (e.g., "current", "trashed", or "any").
Defaults to "current". If explicitly set to None, it's treated like "current" by the core logic.
If "any", the status filter is ignored.

postingDay.description:
The posting day of the content. This filter is only applied
if the content type is "blogpost". Format: yyyy-mm-dd. Example: "2024-01-01".

expand.description:
A comma-separated list of additional fields to include in the
returned content objects. Supported values:
- space: Expands the space field with space key
- version: Expands the version information
- history: Expands the content history

start.description: The starting index for pagination. Defaults to 0.

limit.description: The maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 25.

get_content_history.name: get_content_history
get_content_history.description:
Returns the history of a piece of content.

This method returns the metadata regarding creation and versioning for the content item
identified by the given id. It uses a global history store (DB["history"]) that is updated
whenever content is created or updated. Each history record includes the version number,
createdBy, createdDate, and lastUpdated timestamp.

The returned structure is a dictionary with the following keys:
    - id (str): The unique identifier of the content.
    - results (List[Dict[str, Any]]): An ordered list (ascending by version number) of history records.
        Each record contains:
          - version (int): The version number.
          - createdBy (str): The user that created or updated that version.
          - createdDate (str): The ISO timestamp when that version was created.
          - lastUpdated (str): The ISO timestamp when that version was last updated.
    - latest (Dict[str, Any]): The latest version record.
    - createdBy (str): The creator from the latest record.
    - createdDate (str): The creation date from the latest record.
    - previousVersion (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]): The previous version record, if available.
    - nextVersion (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]): Always None, since the current version is the latest.

id.description: Unique identifier of the content.

expand.description:
A comma-separated list of additional fields to expand
(e.g., "previousVersion,nextVersion,lastUpdated").
This parameter is not used to filter the output in this simulation.

get_content_children.name: get_content_children
get_content_children.description: Returns a mapping of direct children content grouped by type.

id.description: Unique identifier of the parent content.

expand.description:
A comma-separated list of additional fields to include.
This parameter is not utilized in this simulation. Defaults to None.

parentVersion.description:
The version number of the parent content. This is included
for potential version-related logic, but is not used in the simulation. Defaults to 0.

Defaults to None.

parentVersion.description:
The version of the parent content. Provided for potential future use; not used
in this simulation. Defaults to 0.

start.description: The starting index for pagination. Defaults to 0.

limit.description: The maximum number of child content items to return. Defaults to 25.

Returns a paginated list of all spaces.

Creates a new space.

Creates and returns a new space dictionary from the provided data.
Note: If 'name' or 'description' are not provided in the body, Pydantic model
validation ensures they default to an empty string.

key.description: The unique identifier for the space. (Mandatory)

name.description: The display name of the space.

description.description: An optional description of the space.

body.description: A dictionary containing:

create_private_space.name: create_private_space
create_private_space.description:
Creates a new private space.

This function behaves identically to create_space and returns a new private space dictionary.

name.description: The display name of the space.

description.description: An optional description of the space.

body.description: A dictionary containing:

update_space.name: update_space
update_space.description:
Updates an existing space.

Updates and returns a space dictionary for the space specified by spaceKey.

spaceKey.description: The unique identifier of the space to update.

name.description: The new display name of the space.

description.description: The new description of the space.

body.description: A dictionary containing the fields to update:

delete_space.name: delete_space
delete_space.description:
Deletes a space and tracks the deletion task.

Deletes the space identified by spaceKey and returns a task dictionary that tracks the deletion process.
Note: The deletion task is simulated and marked as complete immediately.

spaceKey.description: The unique identifier of the space to delete.

get_space_details.name: get_space_details
get_space_details.description:
Retrieves details about a specific space.

Returns the space dictionary for the provided spaceKey.

spaceKey.description: The unique identifier of the space.

get_space_content.name: get_space_content
get_space_content.description:
Retrieves the content within a specific space.

Returns a list of content item dictionaries for the space identified by spaceKey.
Note: The 'depth' and 'expand' parameters are included for API compatibility but are not fully implemented.

spaceKey.description: The unique identifier of the space. Must be a non-empty string.

depth.description: The depth of content to retrieve. Defaults to None.

expand.description: A comma-separated list of properties to expand. Defaults to None.

start.description:
The starting index for pagination.
Defaults to 0. Must be a non-negative integer.

limit.description:
The maximum number of content items to return.
Defaults to 25. Must be a positive integer.

get_space_content_by_type.name: get_space_content_by_type
get_space_content_by_type.description:
Retrieves content of a specific type within a space.

Returns a list of content item dictionaries matching the specified type for the given spaceKey.
Note: The function first retrieves all content for the space and then filters by type.
      The 'depth' and 'expand' parameters are accepted for API compatibility but are not fully implemented.

spaceKey.description: The unique identifier of the space.

depth.description: The depth of content to retrieve. Defaults to None.

expand.description: A comma-separated list of properties to expand. Defaults to None.

type.description: The type of content to filter (e.g., "page", "blogpost").

start.description:
The starting index for pagination after filtering.
Defaults to 0.

limit.description:
The maximum number of content items to return after filtering.
Defaults to 25.

get_long_tasks.name: get_long_tasks
get_long_tasks.description:
Returns a paginated list of all long-running tasks.

Retrieves a list of task dictionaries for all long-running tasks.
Note: The 'expand' parameter is accepted for API compatibility but is not currently processed.

A comma-separated list of properties to expand.
Defaults to None.
Note: Not implemented.

start.description:
The starting index for pagination.
Defaults to 0.

limit.description:
The maximum number of tasks to return.
Defaults to 100.

get_long_task_details.description:

Retrieves the long-running task dictionary that matches the provided task ID.
Note: The 'expand' parameter is accepted for API compatibility but is not currently processed.

expand.description:
A comma-separated list of properties to expand.
Defaults to None.

make_call.name: make_call
make_call.description:
Make a call to a single recipient with exactly one phone number endpoint.

To resolve the phone number endpoint, you may have to call one or more tools
prior to calling this operation. Before calling this operation, always check
if the Geofencing Policy applies. If there is a recipient with more than one
phone number endpoints, ask the user for the intended endpoint by invoking
show_call_recipient_choices. Do not call this operation until the user has
chosen a single recipient with exactly one phone number endpoint.

contact_endpoints.description: List of endpoints for the contact

contact_photo_url.description: URL to the contact's profile photo

recipient.description: The recipient of the phone call. Contains:

on_speakerphone.description:
If True, the phone call will be placed on the
speakerphone. Defaults to False.

recipient_phone_number.description:
The phone number of the
recipient to make the call to, e.g. "+11234567890".

recipient_photo_url.description:
The url to the profile photo
of the recipient.

prepare_call.name: prepare_call
prepare_call.description: Prepare a call to one or more recipients, given provided recipient information.

contact_endpoints.description: List of endpoints for the contact

contact_photo_url.description: URL to the contact's profile photo

recipients.description:
A list of recipient objects to
prepare call cards for. Each recipient dict contains:

show_call_recipient_choices.name: show_call_recipient_choices
show_call_recipient_choices.description:
Show a list of one or more recipients to the user to choose from.

This operation uses a UI component to show the list of choices. You do not
need to enumerate the list of choices in your final response. If you call
this operation, you may not call other operations from this tool before
drafting the final response.

Invoke this operation in the following scenarios:
    * There are multiple recipients (contacts or businesses) to choose from.
    * There are multiple phone number endpoints for a business to choose from.
    * There are multiple phone number endpoints for a single contact to choose from.
    * There is a single contact recipient with `confidence_level` LOW.
    * The Geofencing Policy applies.

contact_endpoints.description: List of endpoints for the contact

contact_photo_url.description: URL to the contact's profile photo

recipients.description:
A list of recipient objects to
display as choices. Each recipient dict contains:

show_call_recipient_not_found_or_specifi.name: show_call_recipient_not_found_or_specified
show_call_recipient_not_found_or_specifi.description:
Show a message to the user when the call recipient is not found or not specified.

You must attempt to search for a recipient before calling this operation.
Call this operation when no match is found for a recipient, or when the user
expresses an intent to call without specifying a recipient.

contact_name.description: The recipient name that was searched for.

list_structures.name: list_structures
list_structures.description:
Lists all the structures.

Makes a GET call to retrieve a list of all structures that the user has authorized
for a given enterprise. The response typically includes a collection of structure objects.

get_device_info.name: get_device_info
get_device_info.description: Retrieves information about an authorized device.

device_id.description: The unique identifier of the device within the enterprise.

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the enterprise or project.

get_events_list.name: get_events_list
get_events_list.description: Returns a list of events that were triggered.

device_id.description: Optional unique identifier of a device to filter events. For example, "CAM_001".

event_type.description:
Optional event_type to filter events.
Should be one of: "Motion", "Person", "Sound" or "Chime".
It also accepts formats such as: "sdm.devices.events.CameraMotion.Motion".
If no device_id or event_type provided, returns all events.

list_devices.name: list_devices
list_devices.description:
Makes a GET call to retrieve a list of all devices that the user has authorized

for a given enterprise. The response typically includes a collection of device objects.

execute_command.name: execute_command
execute_command.description: Executes a command on a specific device managed by the enterprise.

device_id.description: The unique identifier of the device within the enterprise. For example, "CAM_001"

project_id.description: The unique identifier of the enterprise or project.

command_request.description: The command request payload, Contains the keys:

command.description:
The name of the command to execute. One of the following (followed by a brief explanation):
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_camera_event_image (retrieve the image from a camera through a triggered event)
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_rtsp_stream (start the rtsp stream mode of a camera)
    - sdm.devices.commands.stop_rtsp_stream (stop the rtsp stream mode of a camera)
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_image_from_rtsp_stream (retrieve the image from a camera through its ongoing rtsp stream)
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_web_rtc_stream (start the web_rtc stream mode of a camera)
    - sdm.devices.commands.stop_web_rtc_stream (stop the web_rtc stream mode of a camera)
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_image_from_web_rtc_stream (retrieve the image from a camera through its ongoing web_rtc stream)

params.description:
Each command may have its own parameters, represented by key, value dictionaries. If None, the command does not have params. Use these as reference:
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_camera_event_image: 
        - event_id: (str): The ID of the triggered event.
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_rtsp_stream: 
        - None.
    - sdm.devices.commands.stop_rtsp_stream:
        - stream_extension_token: (str): The extension token of the stream to stop.
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_image_from_rtsp_stream: 
        - rtsp_url: (str): The RTSP URL of the stream.
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_web_rtc_stream:
        - offer_sdp: (str): The SDP of the offer.
    - sdm.devices.commands.stop_web_rtc_stream:
        - stream_media_session_id: (str): The media session ID of the stream to stop.
    - sdm.devices.commands.generate_image_from_web_rtc_stream:
        - answer_sdp: (str): The SDP of the answer.

IsAllDayEvent.description: Whether the event is all day.

event_id.description: The ID of the event to delete.

describe_event_layout.description: Describes the layout of an event.

event_id.description: The ID of the event to describe.

query_events.name: query_events
query_events.description: Queries events based on specified criteria.

IsAllDayEvent.description: Whether the event is all day.

criteria.description: Key-value pairs to filter events. Example:

retrieve_event_details.name: retrieve_event_details
retrieve_event_details.description: Retrieves details of a specific event.

event_id.description: The ID of the event to retrieve.

search_events.name: search_events
search_events.description: Searches for events based on specified search criteria.

search_term.description: The term to search for in event fields.

undelete_event.description: Restores a deleted event. (Place holder - no actual deletion tracking).

The ID of the event to update.

IsAllDayEvent.description: Whether the event is all day.
Whether the event is all day.

execute_soql_query.name: execute_soql_query
execute_soql_query.description:
Executes a SOQL-like query against the in-memory database.

The query string is first URL-decoded. 
The parser has specific behaviors and improved parsing logic as detailed below.

q.description:
The SOQL-like query string. Example:
"SELECT Name, Location FROM Event WHERE Location = 'Boardroom' ORDER BY Name ASC OFFSET 0 LIMIT 5"

parse_where_clause_conditions.name: parse_where_clause_conditions
parse_where_clause_conditions.description:
Parse the conditions in the WHERE clause.

Handles '=', 'IN', 'LIKE', and 'CONTAINS'.

conditions.description:
List of condition strings to parse. Example:
- "Subject = 'Meeting'"
- "IsAllDayEvent = true"
- "Location IN ('Boardroom', 'Conference Room')"
- "Description LIKE '%important%'"
- "Subject CONTAINS 'review'"

Id.description: Custom ID for the task. If not provided, a UUID will be generated.

DueDate.description: Alternative field for task due date.

task_id.description: The ID of the task to delete.

describe_task_layout.name: describe_task_layout
describe_task_layout.description: Describes the layout of a task.

query_tasks.name: query_tasks
query_tasks.description: Queries tasks based on specified criteria.

criteria.description:
Key-value pairs to filter tasks.
If provided, the dictionary structure is validated. Example:
{
    "Subject": Optional[str],
    "Priority": Optional[str],
    "Status": Optional[str],
    "ActivityDate": Optional[str] # e.g., "2024-01-01"
}
All keys within the criteria dictionary are optional.

task_id.description: The ID of the task to retrieve.

search_tasks.name: search_tasks
search_tasks.description: Searches for tasks based on specified search criteria.

search_term.description: The term to search for in task fields.

undelete_task.name: undelete_task
undelete_task.description: Recovers deleted tasks. (Placeholder - no actual deletion tracking).

task_id.description: The ID of the task to undelete.
The ID of the task to update.

get_message_reactions.name: get_message_reactions
get_message_reactions.description:
Gets reactions for a specific message in a channel.

This function is used to get reactions for a specific message in a channel.
It can return either a summary of the reactions or all the reaction details.
If full is True, it returns all the reaction details.
If full is False, it returns a summary of the reactions.

channel_id.description: ID of the channel. Cannot be empty.

message_ts.description:
The timestamp of the message to get reactions for.
This should be a string representation of a Unix timestamp with
up to 6 decimal places for microsecond precision. Cannot be empty.

full.description: If true, return all reaction details. Defaults to False.

add_reaction_to_message.name: add_reaction_to_message
add_reaction_to_message.description: Adds a reaction to a message.

user_id.description: User ID. Must be a non-empty string.

channel_id.description: ID of the channel. Must be a non-empty string.

name.description: Reaction (emoji) name. Must be a non-empty string.

message_ts.description:
Timestamp of the message. This should be a string
representation of a Unix timestamp with up to 6 decimal places
for microsecond precision. Must be a non-empty string.

list_user_reactions.name: list_user_reactions
list_user_reactions.description: Lists reactions made by a user (or all users if user_id is None).

user_id.description:
Show reactions made by this user. Defaults to None (all users).
If provided, must be a non-empty string.

full.description: If true, return all reaction details. Defaults to False.

cursor.description:
Parameter for pagination. Defaults to None.
If provided, must be a string that can be parsed as a non-negative integer.

limit.description:
The maximum number of items to return. Defaults to 100.
Must be a positive integer.

remove_reaction_from_message.name: remove_reaction_from_message
remove_reaction_from_message.description: Removes a reaction from a message.

user_id.description: User ID. Must be a non-empty string.

name.description: Reaction (emoji) name. Must be a non-empty string.

channel_id.description: ID of the channel. Must be a non-empty string.

message_ts.description: Timestamp of the message. Must be a non-empty string.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to get info for. Must be a non-empty string.

cursor.description: Pagination cursor for comments. Must be a string representing a non-negative integer. Defaults to None.

limit.description: Maximum number of comments to return. Must be a positive integer. Defaults to 100.

share_file.name: share_file
share_file.description:
Shares an existing file into specified channels.

This function allows sharing a file that already exists in the Slack workspace
to one or more channels. The file must exist in the files database and all
specified channels must be valid.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to share. Must be a non-empty string.

channel_ids.description:
Comma-separated list of channel IDs to share the file with.
Must be a non-empty string with valid channel IDs.

add_remote_file.name: add_remote_file
add_remote_file.description:
Add a remote file to the Slack workspace.

This function registers an external file in Slack's database, allowing it to be referenced
and shared within the Slack workspace. The file itself remains hosted externally.

external_id.description:
A unique identifier for the file in the external system.
Must be a non-empty string.

external_url.description:
The URL where the file can be accessed.
Must be a non-empty string.

title.description:
The display title for the file in Slack.
Must be a non-empty string.

filetype.description:
The type/extension of the file (e.g., "pdf", "docx").
Must be a non-empty string if provided. Defaults to None.

indexable_file_contents.description:
Text content that can be indexed for search.
Must be a non-empty string if provided. Defaults to None.

delete_file.name: delete_file
delete_file.description:
Deletes a file from the Slack workspace.

This function permanently removes a file from the Slack workspace, including
from all channels where it was shared.

file_id.description: The ID of the file to delete. Must be a non-empty string.

upload_file.name: upload_file
upload_file.description:
Upload a file to Slack.

It supports uploading files either by providing content directly or by specifying a file path.
The function automatically detects file types, MIME types, and handles both text and binary files.
Files are subject to a 50MB size limit.

channels.description:
Comma-separated list of channel IDs where the file will be shared.
Must be valid channel IDs if provided.

content.description:
File contents as a string. If both content and file_path are provided,
content takes precedence. Subject to 50MB size limit.

file_path.description:
Path to a local file to upload. The file will be read and its
content will be processed based on the file type (text or binary). Subject to 50MB size limit.

filename.description:
Name of the file. If not provided and file_path is given,
the filename will be extracted from the file path.

filetype.description:
File type identifier (e.g., 'pdf', 'txt', 'jpg').
If not provided, it will be auto-detected from the filename or file path.

initial_comment.description: Initial comment to add with the file.

thread_ts.description: Timestamp of parent message to reply to in a thread.

title.description: Title of the file. If not provided, defaults to filename.

finish_external_file_upload.name: finish_external_file_upload
finish_external_file_upload.description: Finishes an external file upload started with `get_external_upload_url()`.

id.description: Required. The ID of the file to update.

title.description: Optional. The new title for the file.

files.description: List of file object dictionaries. Each dictionary must contain:

channel_id.description: Channel ID where the file will be shared.

list_files.name: list_files
list_files.description:
Lists files, optionally filtered by channel, user, and time.

This function retrieves files from the Slack workspace with optional filtering capabilities.
Files can be filtered by channel, user, timestamp range, and file types. Results are paginated
for efficient data retrieval.

channel_id.description: Filter files shared in a specific channel. Must be a valid channel ID if provided.

user_id.description: Filter files uploaded by a specific user. Must be a valid user ID if provided.

ts_from.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive). Must be a Unix timestamp string if provided.

ts_to.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive). Must be a Unix timestamp string if provided.

types.description: Comma-separated list of file types to filter by (e.g., "pdf,docx,jpg").

cursor.description: Pagination cursor for retrieving additional results. Must be a string representing a non-negative integer.

limit.description: Maximum number of files to return per page. Must be a positive integer. Defaults to 100.

remove_remote_file.name: remove_remote_file
remove_remote_file.description:
Remove a remote file and clean up all of its references.

Exactly **one** identifier must be supplied – either a Slack-generated
``file_id`` *or* the external ``external_id`` that was provided when the
file was first registered.  When the target is found the file record is
deleted from the workspace's internal storage and its identifier is
removed from every channel that had access to the file.

file_id.description: The unique Slack-generated ID of the file to remove.

external_id.description:
The creator-defined GUID that was supplied when the remote file
was added via :pyfunc:`add_remote_file` or the external upload
flow.

get_external_upload_url.name: get_external_upload_url
get_external_upload_url.description:
Generates a URL for uploading an external file to Slack.

This function initiates the file upload process by providing a secure,
temporary URL to which the file data can be sent. It takes basic file
information, such as its name and size, and returns a unique file ID
and the corresponding upload URL. It also starts a 1-minute timer to
automatically delete the file record if the upload is not completed.

filename.description: The name of the file to be uploaded.

length.description: The size of the file in bytes.

alt_txt.description:
A description of the file used for
accessibility purposes (e.g., by screen readers).

snippet_type.description:
The specific type of snippet, which
can be used to influence how the file is displayed.

user_id.description: User ID of the user leaving the conversation.

channel.description: Conversation to leave.
The ID of the channel to invite users to. Must be a non-empty string.

users.description: A comma separated list of user IDs. Must be a non-empty string.

force.description: Continue inviting valid users even if some are invalid. Defaults to False.

archive_conversation.name: archive_conversation
archive_conversation.description:
Archives a conversation by setting its archived status and closing it.

Archiving a conversation marks it as archived (is_archived=True) and closes it 
(is_open=False) in the database. Archived conversations are typically hidden 
from regular channel lists and are no longer actively used.

channel.description: ID of conversation to archive. Must be a non-empty string.

If False, returns minimal channel information. Defaults to False.

search_messages.name: search_messages
search_messages.description:
Searches for messages matching a query.

The query is a space-separated string of terms and filters. Text terms are
matched against the message's content. By default, all text terms must be
present in the message (AND logic).

query.description:
The search query. The structure is a space-separated string
of terms and filters. Supported filters are:
- `from:@<user>`: Restricts the search to messages from a specific user.
- `in:#<channel>`: Restricts the search to a specific channel.
- `has:link`: Narrows search to messages that contain a URL.
- `has:reaction`: Narrows search to messages that have a reaction.
- `has:star`: Narrows search to messages that have been starred.
- `before:YYYY-MM-DD`: Filters for messages sent before a specific date.
- `after:YYYY-MM-DD`: Filters for messages sent after a specific date.
- `during:YYYY-MM-DD`: Filters for messages on a specific date. Also
  supports `YYYY` for a year or `YYYY-MM` for a month.
- `-<word>`: Excludes messages containing the specified word.
- `some*`: Wildcard support for partial word matching.
- `OR`: When used between text terms (e.g., "hello OR world"), the
  logic changes to match messages containing any of the terms.

search_files.name: search_files
search_files.description:
Searches for files matching a query.

The query is a space-separated string of terms and filters. Text terms are
matched against the file's name and title. If multiple text terms are
provided, a match occurs if any term is found (OR logic).

query.description:
The search query. The structure is a space-separated string
of terms and filters. Supported filters for files are:
- `in:#<channel>`: Restricts the search to a specific channel.
- `filetype:<type>`: Narrows search to a specific file type (e.g., 'pdf', 'image').
- `has:star`: Narrows search to files that have been starred.
Note: Date filters, user filters (`from:`), exclusion (`-`), and
wildcards (`*`) are not applicable to file searches.

search_all_content.name: search_all_content
search_all_content.description:
Searches for messages and files matching a query.

This function executes a search across both messages and files using a single
query. The query is a space-separated string of terms and filters. Filters
are applied to the resource type they are relevant to (e.g., `filetype:`
only applies to files).

query.description:
The search query. The structure is a space-separated string
of terms and filters.

For Text Terms:
- In Messages: Matched against message content. Default logic is AND,
  but `OR` can be used to match any term.
- In Files: Matched against the file's name and title. The logic is
  always OR (any term match).

Supported Filters:
- `in:#<channel>`: (Messages & Files) Restricts search to a channel.
- `has:star`: (Messages & Files) Narrows to starred items.
- `from:@<user>`: (Messages-only) Restricts to messages from a user.
- `has:link`: (Messages-only) Narrows to messages containing a URL.
- `has:reaction`: (Messages-only) Narrows to messages with reactions.
- `before:`, `after:`, `during:`: (Messages-only) Date-based filters.
- `-<word>`: (Messages-only) Excludes messages with the word.
- `some*`: (Messages-only) Wildcard support.
- `filetype:<type>`: (Files-only) Narrows to a specific file type.

run_python_script_in_blender.name: run_python_script_in_blender
run_python_script_in_blender.description:
Execute arbitrary Python code in Blender simulation environment.

Allows access to functions/classes from dynamically discovered API modules 
(in the same directory as this file, e.g., object.py, scene.py),
classes from SimulationEngine.models, and the _simulation_db object.

This function facilitates the execution of arbitrary Python code within Blender.
It operates on a step-by-step basis, meaning the provided code should be
broken into smaller, manageable chunks. The 'code' parameter accepts the
Python code string for execution.

get_hyper3d_status.name: get_hyper3d_status
get_hyper3d_status.description:
Check if Hyper3D Rodin integration is enabled in Blender.

This function checks if Hyper3D Rodin integration is enabled in Blender.
It returns a message indicating whether Hyper3D Rodin features are available.
The function is also instructed not to emphasize the key type in the returned
message, but to silently remember it.

generate_hyper3d_model_via_text.name: generate_hyper3d_model_via_text
generate_hyper3d_model_via_text.description:
Generate 3D asset using Hyper3D by giving description of the desired asset, and import the asset into Blender.

The 3D asset has built-in materials. The generated model has a normalized size, so re-scaling after generation can be useful.

text_prompt.description: A short description of the desired model in **English**.

bbox_condition.description: Optional. If given, it has to be a list of floats of length 3. Controls the ratio between [Length, Width, Height] of the model.

generate_hyper3d_model_via_images.name: generate_hyper3d_model_via_images
generate_hyper3d_model_via_images.description:
Generate 3D asset using Hyper3D by giving images of the wanted asset, and import the generated asset into Blender.

This function generates a 3D asset using Hyper3D by providing images of the
desired asset, and subsequently imports the generated asset into Blender.
The 3D asset created comes with built-in materials. The model generated
has a normalized size, so re-scaling might be beneficial after generation.
Only one of `input_image_paths` or `input_image_urls` should be provided
at a time, depending on the current mode of Hyper3D Rodin.

input_image_paths.description:
The **absolute** paths of input
images. Even if only one image is provided, wrap it into a list.
Required if Hyper3D Rodin in MAIN_SITE mode. Defaults to None.

input_image_urls.description:
The URLs of input images. Even
if only one image is provided, wrap it into a list. Required if
Hyper3D Rodin in FAL_AI mode. Defaults to None.

bbox_condition.description:
Optional. If given, it has to be a
list of ints of length 3. Controls the ratio between
[Length, Width, Height] of the model. Defaults to None.

poll_hyper3d_rodin_job_status.name: poll_hyper3d_rodin_job_status
poll_hyper3d_rodin_job_status.description:
Check if the Hyper3D Rodin generation task is completed.

This function checks the status of a Hyper3D Rodin generation task. Its behavior
and the interpretation of status depend on the operational mode, inferred from
which identifier (`subscription_key` or `request_id`) is provided.

For Hyper3D Rodin mode MAIN_SITE (when `subscription_key` is provided):
The function assesses completion based on a list of statuses related to the job.
The task is considered done if all these statuses are "Done". If "Failed"
appears among the statuses, the generating process has failed. This function
is designed for polling; callers should only proceed if the statuses are
finally determined (e.g., "Done" or "Canceled").

For Hyper3D Rodin mode FAL_AI (when `request_id` is provided):
The function assesses completion based on the overall generation task status.
The task is considered done if this status is "COMPLETED". The task is
in progress if the status is "IN_PROGRESS". If a status other than
"COMPLETED", "IN_PROGRESS", or "IN_QUEUE" is encountered, the generating
process might have failed. This function is designed for polling; callers
should only proceed if the status is finally determined (e.g., "COMPLETED"
or a recognized failed state).

subscription_key.description:
The subscription_key given in the generate model step,
used for polling in MAIN_SITE mode. Defaults to None.

request_id.description:
The request_id given in the generate model step,
used for polling in FAL_AI mode. Defaults to None.

import_hyper3d_generated_asset.name: import_hyper3d_generated_asset
import_hyper3d_generated_asset.description:
Import the asset generated by Hyper3D Rodin after the generation task is completed.

This function imports an asset generated by Hyper3D Rodin. It requires specific identifiers
(`task_uuid` or `request_id`) based on the Hyper3D Rodin mode used for generation.
Only one of these identifiers should be provided. The function's output details
the success of the import operation.

name.description: The name of the object in scene.

task_uuid.description: For Hyper3D Rodin mode MAIN_SITE: The task_uuid given in the generate model step. Defaults to string "null".

request_id.description: For Hyper3D Rodin mode FAL_AI: The request_id given in the generate model step. Defaults to string "null".

get_object_info.name: get_object_info
get_object_info.description:
Get detailed information about a specific object in the Blender scene.

This function gets detailed information about a specific object in the Blender scene.

object_name.description: The name of the object to get information about.

set_object_texture.name: set_object_texture
set_object_texture.description: Apply a previously downloaded Polyhaven texture to an object.

object_name.description: Name of the object to apply the texture to.

texture_id.description: ID of the Polyhaven texture to apply (must be downloaded first).

get_polyhaven_categories.name: get_polyhaven_categories
get_polyhaven_categories.description: Get a list of categories for a specific asset type on Polyhaven.

asset_type.description:
The type of asset to get categories for 
(hdris, textures, models, all). Defaults to "hdris".

search_polyhaven_assets.name: search_polyhaven_assets
search_polyhaven_assets.description:
Search for assets on Polyhaven with optional filtering.

This function searches for assets on Polyhaven. It allows specifying the
`asset_type` (such as 'hdris', 'textures', 'models', or 'all') and an
optional comma-separated list of `categories` for filtering. The function
returns a list of matching assets, where each asset includes basic
information.

asset_type.description: Asset Type. Defaults to "all". Type validation is handled internally.

categories.description: Categories. Defaults to None. Type validation is handled internally.

download_polyhaven_asset.name: download_polyhaven_asset
download_polyhaven_asset.description: This function downloads a Polyhaven asset, identified by its `asset_id` and `asset_type`, and imports it into Blender.

asset_id.description: The ID of the asset to download.

asset_type.description: The type of asset (hdris, textures, models).

resolution.description: The resolution to download (e.g., 1k, 2k, 4k). Defaults to "1k".

file_format.description: Optional file format (e.g., hdr, exr for HDRIs; jpg, png for textures; gltf, fbx for models). Defaults to None.

get_polyhaven_status.name: get_polyhaven_status
get_polyhaven_status.description:
Checks if PolyHaven integration is enabled in Blender and returns a message indicating whether

PolyHaven features are available.

get_scene_info.name: get_scene_info
get_scene_info.description:
Get detailed information about the current Blender scene.

This function retrieves comprehensive information about the current Blender scene.
The details encompass the scene's name, counts of cameras, objects, and
lights, the name of the active camera if one exists, settings for the world
environment including ambient and horizon colors, and various rendering
configurations like the engine, resolution, and output filepath.

create_user.name: create_user
create_user.description: Creates a new user with a given ID, name, and username.

user_id.description: The unique identifier for the user.

name.description: The name of the user.

get_user_details.name: get_user_details
get_user_details.description: Retrieves information about a specific user.

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user to retrieve. Cannot be empty.

list_all_users.name: list_all_users
list_all_users.description: Lists all users in the system.

delete_user.name: delete_user
delete_user.description: Deletes a specified user from the system.

user_id.description: The unique identifier of the user to delete.

get_user_id_by_username.name: get_user_id_by_username
get_user_id_by_username.description: Searches for a user by their username and returns the corresponding user ID.

username.description:
The username to look up in the system.
This field cannot be an empty string or contain only whitespace.

create_media_post.name: create_media_post
create_media_post.description: Creates a new media post associated with a user.

user_id.description: The ID of the user who owns the media. Must be a non-empty string.

image_url.description: URL of the media image. Must be a non-empty string.

caption.description:
Caption or description for the media. Must be a string.
Defaults to "".

list_all_media_posts.name: list_all_media_posts
list_all_media_posts.description: Lists all media posts in the system.

delete_media_post.name: delete_media_post
delete_media_post.description: Deletes a specified media post from the system.

media_id.description:
The unique identifier of the media post to delete.
Must be a non-empty string.

add_comment_to_media.name: add_comment_to_media
add_comment_to_media.description: Adds a comment to a media post.

media_id.description: The ID of the media post being commented on.

user_id.description: The ID of the user making the comment.

list_media_comments.name: list_media_comments
list_media_comments.description: Lists all comments on a specific media post.

media_id.description: The ID of the media post to retrieve comments for.

get_notifications.name: get_notifications
get_notifications.description: Get Android notifications with optional filtering.

sender_name.description:
Filter notifications by sender/group name. 
Must be a non-empty string with maximum length of 256 characters if provided.

app_name.description:
Filter notifications by application name.
Must be a non-empty string with maximum length of 256 characters if provided.

unread.description:
If True (default), fetches only unread notifications and marks them as read.
If False, fetches only read notifications without changing their read status.

reply_notification.name: reply_notification
reply_notification.description: Reply to a notification with confirmation.

key.description:
Unique bundle identifier to reply to. Must be a non-empty string
with maximum length of 256 characters.

message_body.description: The reply message text. Must be a non-empty string.

recipient_name.description:
Display name of the recipient. Must be a non-empty string
with maximum length of 256 characters.

app_name.description:
Optional application name for the reply.
Must be a non-empty string with maximum length of 256 characters if provided.

app_package_name.description:
Optional package name. This parameter is not used 
in the current implementation but is validated for API compatibility.
Must be a non-empty string with maximum length of 256 characters if provided.

reply_notification_message_or_contact_mi.name: reply_notification_message_or_contact_missing
reply_notification_message_or_contact_mi.description:
Handle cases where message body or recipient is missing.

This function is called when a reply attempt is made without
providing the necessary information (message body or recipient name).

trash_thread.name: trash_thread
trash_thread.description:
Moves the specified thread to the trash.

This operation marks the thread and all messages within it as trashed.
It utilizes the `Messages.trash` function for each message in the thread.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the thread to trash. Defaults to ''.

untrash_thread.name: untrash_thread
untrash_thread.description:
Removes the specified thread from the trash.

This operation restores the thread and all messages within it from the trash.
It utilizes the `Messages.untrash` function for each message in the thread.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the thread to untrash. Defaults to ''.

delete_thread.name: delete_thread
delete_thread.description:
Immediately and permanently deletes the specified thread.

This operation cannot be undone. It removes the thread and all associated
messages from the user's mailbox permanently.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the thread to delete. Defaults to ''.

get_thread.name: get_thread
get_thread.description:
Gets the specified thread.

Retrieves the details of a specific thread identified by its ID.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the thread to retrieve. Defaults to ''.

format.description:
The format to return the messages in. Accepted values are:
- 'full': Returns the full message data including body and all fields
- 'metadata': Returns message ID, labels, and headers (either specified or default)
- 'minimal': Returns only message ID and labels
- 'raw': Returns the full message data (same as 'full' in this implementation)
Defaults to 'full'.

metadata_headers.description:
A list of headers to include when format is set
to 'metadata'. If None, includes default headers (Subject, From, To, Date).
Case-insensitive matching is used for common headers. Defaults to None.

list_threads.name: list_threads
list_threads.description:
Lists the threads in the user's mailbox.

Retrieves a list of threads matching the specified query criteria.
Note: Query parameters (`q`, `labelIds`, `include_spam_trash`, `page_token`)
are included for API compatibility but are not fully implemented.
The filtering based on these parameters is not performed.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

max_results.description:
Maximum number of threads to return. Defaults to 100.
Actual results might be fewer if less threads exist. The maximum allowed value is 500.

page_token.description:
Page token to retrieve a specific page of results.
Defaults to ''. (Currently ignored).

q.description:
Only return threads matching the specified query. Supports the same
query format as the Gmail search box. Defaults to ''. (Currently ignored).

labelIds.description:
Only return threads with labels that match all of the specified
label IDs in uppercase. Defaults to None. (Currently ignored).

include_spam_trash.description:
Include threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results.
Defaults to False. (Currently ignored).

modify_thread_labels.name: modify_thread_labels
modify_thread_labels.description:
Modifies the labels applied to the specified thread.

Adds or removes labels from all messages within the specified thread.
It utilizes the `Messages.modify` function for each message in the thread.

userId.description: The user's email address. The special value 'me' can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

id.description: The ID of the thread to modify.

addLabelIds.description: A list of IDs of labels to add to this message. You can add up to 100 labels with each update.

removeLabelIds.description: A list of IDs of labels to remove from this message. You can remove up to 100 labels with each update.

get_user_profile.name: get_user_profile
get_user_profile.description:
Gets the user's Gmail profile information.

Retrieves the profile data associated with the specified user ID from the database.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

watch_user_mailbox.name: watch_user_mailbox
watch_user_mailbox.description:
Set up or update a watch on the user's mailbox.

Stores the watch request configuration for the specified user.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

request.description:
An optional dictionary containing the watch request body.
The exact structure depends on the watch configuration requirements.
Defaults to None, resulting in an empty watch configuration.

stop_mailbox_watch.name: stop_mailbox_watch
stop_mailbox_watch.description:
Stop receiving push notifications for the user's mailbox.

Clears the stored watch configuration for the specified user.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

check_user_exists.name: check_user_exists
check_user_exists.description: Checks if a user exists in the database.

userId.description: The ID of the user to check.

create_user.name: create_user
create_user.description:
Creates a new user entry in the database.

Initializes the data structure for a new user, including profile,
empty containers for drafts, messages, threads, labels, settings, history,
and watch configuration.

userId.description: The unique identifier for the new user.

profile.description:
A dictionary containing the initial profile information.
It must contain an 'emailAddress' (str) key. Other keys are permitted but ignored
by this function's core logic beyond validation of 'emailAddress'.
Example: {"emailAddress": "user@example.com", "displayName": "John Doe"}

create_label.name: create_label
create_label.description:
Creates a new label.

Generates a unique ID for the new label and adds it to the user's list
of labels in the database. The label properties are taken from the `label`
argument. If no properties are provided, default values are used.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

name.description: The display name of the label in uppercase.

messageListVisibility.description:
The visibility of messages with this label in the message list.
    Must be one of: 'show', 'hide'. Defaults to 'show'.

labelListVisibility.description:
The visibility of the label in the label list.
    Must be one of: 'labelShow', 'labelShowIfUnread', 'labelHide'. Defaults to 'labelShow'.

type.description:
The owner type for the label. Must be 'user' for custom labels.
    Defaults to 'user'. (Note: 'system' is also a valid type internally).

textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as hex string.

backgroundColor.description: The background color represented as hex string #RRGGBB.

color.description: The color to assign to the label with keys:

label.description: An optional dictionary containing the properties for the new label with keys:

delete_label.name: delete_label
delete_label.description:
Immediately and permanently deletes the specified label.

Removes the label identified by the given ID from the user's list of labels.
This operation cannot be undone.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the label to delete. Defaults to ''.

get_label.name: get_label
get_label.description:
Gets the specified label.

Retrieves the label resource identified by the given ID.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the label to retrieve. Defaults to ''.

list_labels.name: list_labels
list_labels.description:
Lists all labels in the user's mailbox.

Retrieves a list of all label resources associated with the specified user.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

update_label.name: update_label
update_label.description:
Updates the specified label.

Modifies an existing label identified by its ID using the properties
provided in the label argument. This performs a full update, replacing
the existing label properties with the new ones.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the label to update. Defaults to ''.

name.description: The display name of the label. For system labels, will be automatically converted to uppercase.

labelListVisibility.description:
The visibility of the label in the label list.
    Must be one of: 'labelShow', 'labelShowIfUnread', 'labelHide'.

messageListVisibility.description:
The visibility of the label in the message list.
    Must be one of: 'show', 'hide'.

type.description:
The owner type for the label. Must be 'user' for custom labels.
    System labels cannot have their type changed.

color.description: The color to assign to the label with keys:

textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as hex string.

backgroundColor.description: The background color represented as hex string #RRGGBB.

label.description:
An optional dictionary containing the updated properties for the
label with keys:

patch_label.name: patch_label
patch_label.description:
Updates the specified label. Alias for update.

This function is an alias for the `update` function. It modifies an
existing label identified by its ID using the properties provided in the
`label` argument. This performs a full update, replacing the existing
label properties with the new ones.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the label to update/patch. Defaults to ''.

name.description: The display name of the label.

messageListVisibility.description:
The visibility of messages with this label
      in the message list. Must be one of: 'show', 'hide'.

labelListVisibility.description:
The visibility of the label in the label list.
      Must be one of: 'labelShow', 'labelShowIfUnread', 'labelHide'.

type.description: The owner type for the label. Must be one of: 'user', 'system'.

messagesTotal.description: The total number of messages with the label.

messagesUnread.description: The number of unread messages with the label.

threadsTotal.description: The total number of threads with the label.

threadsUnread.description: The number of unread threads with the label.

textColor.description: The text color of the label, represented as hex string.

backgroundColor.description: The background color represented as hex string #RRGGBB.

color.description: The color assigned to the label with keys:

label.description:
An optional dictionary containing the properties to update
the label. Defaults to None, which results in an empty dictionary.
Optional fields:

create_draft.name: create_draft
create_draft.description:
Creates a new draft message.

Creates a new draft with the DRAFT label. The draft message content is taken from the `draft`
argument. If no draft content is provided, an empty draft is created.

Attachment size limits are enforced: individual attachments cannot exceed 25MB,
and the total message size (including all attachments) cannot exceed 100MB.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The draft ID. Auto-generated if not provided.

threadId.description: The ID of the thread this message belongs to.

raw.description:
The entire message represented as a base64url-encoded string
              (RFC 4648 Section 5). The raw string must be RFC 2822 compliant and may include attachments
              (e.g., as multipart MIME). Individual attachments are limited to 25MB each, with
              a total message size limit of 100MB. Optional; if not provided, the message will be 
              constructed from 'sender', 'recipient', 'subject', 'body', etc.

labelIds.description: List of label IDs applied to this message.

snippet.description: A short part of the message text.

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

internalDate.description: The internal message creation timestamp (epoch ms).

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

sender.description: The email address of the sender.

recipient.description: The email address of the recipient.

body.description: The message body text.

isRead.description: Whether the message has been read.

date.description: The date this message was created.

payload.description: The parsed email structure with keys:

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes (max 25MB per attachment).

body.description: The body content with keys:

parts.description: List of message parts for attachments:

draft.description: An optional dictionary containing the draft message details with keys:

list_drafts.name: list_drafts
list_drafts.description:
Lists the drafts in the user's mailbox.

Retrieves a list of draft messages for the specified user, optionally
filtered by a query string. Supports basic filtering based on `from:`, `to:`,
`subject:`, `body:`, `label:`, and general keywords in the query `q`.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

max_results.description:
Maximum number of drafts to return. Must be positive.
Defaults to 100.

q.description:
Query string to filter drafts. Supports terms like `from:`, `to:`,
`subject:`, `body:`, `label:`, and keywords. Defaults to ''.

Examples:
    - "from:john@example.com" - Find drafts from john@example.com
    - "to:team@company.com" - Find drafts to team@company.com
    - "subject:meeting" - Find drafts with "meeting" in the subject
    - "body:project" - Find drafts containing "project" in the body
    - "label:important" - Find drafts with the "important" label
    - "from:john@example.com subject:meeting" - Combine multiple filters

update_draft.name: update_draft
update_draft.description:
Replaces a draft's content.

Updates an existing draft message identified by its ID with the content
provided in the `draft` argument. If the draft with the specified ID
does not exist, it returns None.
Ensures the 'DRAFT' label is present on the updated message.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the draft to update.
The immutable ID of the message.

threadId.description: The ID of the thread this message belongs to.

raw.description:
The entire message represented as a base64url-encoded string
              (RFC 4648 Section 5). The raw string must be RFC 2822 compliant and may include attachments
              (e.g., as multipart MIME). Optional; if not provided, the message will be constructed from 'sender', 'recipient', 'subject', 'body', etc.

labelIds.description:
List of label IDs applied to this message. If provided,
      replaces all existing labels except 'DRAFT' (which is always preserved). The 'INBOX' label
      is explicitly removed if present in the input list.

snippet.description: A short part of the message text.

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

internalDate.description: The internal message creation timestamp (epoch ms).

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

sender.description: The email address of the sender.

recipient.description: The email address of the recipient.

body.description: The message body text.

isRead.description: Whether the message has been read.

date.description: The date this message was created.

payload.description: The parsed email structure with keys:

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes.

body.description: The body content with keys:

parts.description: List of message parts for attachments:

draft.description: An optional dictionary containing the updated draft message content with keys:

delete_draft.name: delete_draft
delete_draft.description:
Immediately and permanently deletes the specified draft.

Removes the draft message identified by the given ID from the user's
mailbox. Also cleans up any attachments that are no longer referenced
after the draft deletion.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the draft to delete. Defaults to ''.

get_draft.name: get_draft
get_draft.description:
Gets the specified draft.

Retrieves the draft message identified by the given ID.
The format parameter determines what data is returned:
- 'minimal': Returns only email message ID and labels
- 'full': Returns the full email message data with parsed body content
- 'raw': Returns the full email message data with body content in raw field
- 'metadata': Returns only email message ID, labels, and email headers

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of the draft to retrieve. Defaults to ''.

format.description:
The format to return the message in. One of 'minimal',
'full', 'raw', or 'metadata'. Defaults to 'full'.

send_draft.name: send_draft
send_draft.description:
Sends the specified draft.

Sends the message associated with a draft. If the `draft` argument contains
an `id` corresponding to an existing draft, that draft is sent and then
deleted. If no `id` is provided, or the `id` doesn't match an existing
draft, the message content within the `draft` argument (specifically
`draft['message']['raw']`) is sent directly using `Messages.send`.

Attachment size limits are enforced: individual attachments cannot exceed 25MB,
and the total message size (including all attachments) cannot exceed 100MB.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

id.description: The ID of an existing draft to send.

message.description: The message content to send directly with keys:

threadId.description: The ID of the thread this message belongs to.

raw.description:
The entire message represented as a base64url-encoded string
              (RFC 4648 Section 5). The raw string must be RFC 2822 compliant and may include attachments
              (e.g., as multipart MIME). Individual attachments are limited to 25MB each, with
              a total message size limit of 100MB. Optional; if not provided, the message will be 
              constructed from 'sender', 'recipient', 'subject', 'body', etc.

internalDate.description: The internal message creation timestamp (epoch ms).

labelIds.description: List of label IDs applied to this message.

snippet.description: A short part of the message text.

historyId.description: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

sizeEstimate.description: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

sender.description: The email address of the sender.

recipient.description: The email address of the recipient.

body.description: The message body text.

isRead.description: Whether the message has been read.

payload.description: The parsed email structure with keys:

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the message.
The MIME type of the part.

size.description: The size of the attachment in bytes (max 25MB per attachment).

body.description: The body content with keys:

parts.description: List of message parts for attachments:

draft.description: An optional dictionary containing the draft to send with keys:

list_history_records.name: list_history_records
list_history_records.description:
Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox.

Retrieves a list of mailbox history records for the specified user.
Note: Filtering parameters (`start_history_id`, `label_id`,
`history_types`) and pagination (`page_token`) are included
for API compatibility but are not fully implemented. The function currently returns
stored history records up to `max_results`.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

max_results.description:
The maximum number of history records to return.
Defaults to 100.

page_token.description:
Page token to retrieve a specific page of results.
Defaults to ''. (Currently ignored).

start_history_id.description:
Returns history records after the specified
`start_history_id`. Defaults to ''. (Currently ignored).

label_id.description:
History records specific to the specified label in uppercase.
Defaults to ''. (Currently ignored).

history_types.description:
History types to retrieve. Defaults to None.
(Currently ignored).

get_auto_forwarding_settings.name: get_auto_forwarding_settings
get_auto_forwarding_settings.description:
Gets the auto-forwarding setting for the specified user.

Retrieves the current auto-forwarding configuration associated with the
user's account from the database.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

update_auto_forwarding_settings.name: update_auto_forwarding_settings
update_auto_forwarding_settings.description:
Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified user.

Modifies the auto-forwarding configuration for the user's account based
on the provided `auto_forwarding_settings`. Only the fields present in the
input dictionary are updated.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

emailAddress.description: Valid email address to forward messages to.

disposition.description:
How to handle forwarded messages.
  Valid values: 'dispositionUnspecified', 'leaveInInbox', 'archive', 'trash', 'markRead'.

auto_forwarding_settings.description:
An optional dictionary containing 
the settings to update with keys:

responseSubject.description: Subject line of the auto-reply message.

responseBodyHtml.description: HTML body of the auto-reply message.

vacation_settings.description:

to update with keys:

smime.description: An optional dictionary containing the S/MIME properties with keys:

userId.description:

delete_send_as_smime_info.description:

send_as_email.description:

to delete the S/MIME info. Defaults to ''.

set_default_send_as_smime_info.name: set_default_send_as_smime_info

Sets the specified S/MIME certificate as the default for the alias.

Marks the S/MIME info identified by `id` as the default configuration
for the given 'Send as' alias, removing the default status from any other
S/MIME configurations for that alias.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description: The email address of the 'Send as' alias. Defaults to ''.

id.description: The ID of the S/MIME info to set as default. Defaults to ''.

list_send_as_aliases.name: list_send_as_aliases
list_send_as_aliases.description:
Lists the 'Send as' aliases for the specified user.

Retrieves all custom 'from' addresses (aliases) associated with the user's
account from the database.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

get_send_as_alias.name: get_send_as_alias
get_send_as_alias.description:
Gets the specified 'Send as' alias configuration.

Retrieves the details of a specific custom 'from' address (alias)
identified by its email address.

can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description:

Defaults to ''.

create_send_as_alias.name: create_send_as_alias
create_send_as_alias.description:
Creates a new 'Send as' alias configuration.

Adds a custom 'from' address (alias) to the user's account. The alias

typically set based on domain policies or user actions, but may default

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

sendAsEmail.description: The email address for the alias.

displayName.description: The display name for the alias.

signature.description: The email signature for the alias.

send_as.description:
An optional dictionary containing the properties for the new
alias with keys:

update_send_as_alias.name: update_send_as_alias
update_send_as_alias.description:
Updates the specified 'Send as' alias configuration.

Modifies an existing custom 'from' address (alias) identified by its email
address, using the properties provided in the `send_as` argument.
This performs a full update.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description:
The email address of the 'Send as' alias to update.
Defaults to ''.

displayName.description: The display name for the alias.

signature.description: The email signature for the alias.

send_as.description: An optional dictionary containing the updated properties with keys:

patch_send_as_alias.name: patch_send_as_alias
patch_send_as_alias.description:
Updates the specified 'Send as' alias configuration. Alias for update.

This function is an alias for the `update` function. It modifies an
existing alias. Note: This implementation performs patch as a full update.

userId.description:
The user's email address. The special value 'me'
can be used to indicate the authenticated user. Defaults to 'me'.

send_as_email.description:
The email address of the alias to update/patch.

displayName.description: The display name for the alias.

signature.description: The email signature for the alias.

send_as.description: An optional dictionary containing the properties to update with keys:

Defaults to ''.

verify_send_as_alias.description:
Verifies the specified 'Send as' alias.

Initiates the verification process for a custom 'from' address. If the alias
